Featured Half Bottle
Barolo, Damilano, "Lecinquevigne", 2020
What better way to start your journey through a wine list than with Barolo: Italy's "King of Wines"? Founded in 1890, the Damilano estate is now in its fourth generation and continues to produce some of the most powerful and compelling wines of the region. The "Lecinquevigne" name refers to the 5 famous vineyards from which their old-vine Nebbiolo grapes are grown: Bussia, Le Coste, Castellero, Ravera, and La Cavourrina.

Sparkling Wine
Featured Other Sparkling
Brut Rosé, Le Vigne di Alice, "Osé", NV
Cinzia and Pier Francesca are part of a new wave of producers going against the grain on cookie-cutter Prosecco, and their "Osé" cuvée, meaning risqué or daring in Italian, exudes this new style. They source their fruit from the highest quality zone in Prosecco of Valdobbiadene Conegliano, but elect to label their wines under Vino Spumante di Qualità. The "Osé" is the quintessential aperitivo wine, lending notes of lingonberries, wild apples, and mountain flowers with class and elegance, the perfect pairing from cicchetti to crudos.

Italian White Wine
Featured Piedmont White
Timorasso, Colli Tortonesi, La Colombera, "Derthona", 2022
From vines nearly lost among the sea of peach and apricot trees and forests of chestnuts ridden with white truffles, Timorasso has risen to become one of Italy's most noble varieties in the 21st century. Since 2000, winemaker Elisa Semino has been a key figure in leading the grape's Renaissance, being locally named the "Queen of Timorasso". Conjuring the je ne sais quoi of Burgundy, a rich mid-palate à la Chenin Blanc, with the exotic perfumed notes of Viognier, Elisa's expression of Derthona displays notes of white peach, tangerine, alpine mountain herbs, and almond flowers finishing with a salty minerality which will have you begging for another sip or bottle...

139
Friuli Venezia Giulia White
Featured Collio
Friulano, La Ponca, 2021
In the Collio region of Friuli Venezia Giulia come some of Italy's finest white wines. The La Ponca estate, found in the hamlet of Scriò, is poised to become one of the great producers of the region. Luscious forests in the foothills of the Alps surround their terraced vineyards that abut the Slovenian border a mere twenty miles from the Mediterranean Sea. The winery takes its name from the "ponca" soil type it sits upon. This soil consists of layers of sandstone alternating with marl and silt that give their wines a distinctive minerality. La Ponca produces a wide range of varietals indigenous to the region with a focus on the famed Friulano. The Friulano grape is typically poured in trattorias throughout Friuli as an aperitif served with prosciutto and cicchetti. La Ponca's expression is a different story that lends notes of flint, pear, and apricots, with a scent of wildflowers and mint in the distance. Where this wine truly shines is its signature textural mouthfeel begging for another sip.

Featured Campania White
Biancolella, Ischia, Antonio Mazzella, 2024
The island of Ischia, the largest of the Phlegrean Islands in the Tyrrhenian Sea, is about 20 mi. offshore from Naples. It is roughly 6 miles east to west and 4 miles north to south, entirely mountainous, and is famous for its thermal gardens created by its volcanic activity. Antonio Mazzella crafts this singular wine from what he describes as "vertical vineyards" on the steep hills mere feet from where the land meets the sea. Brimming forth with sun-kissed freshness and radiant texture, not many wines can convey a "sense of place" quite like this one, just try to not be swept away to an island paradise after one sip.

American White Wine
Featured Chardonnay
Failla, Sonoma Coast, 2022
First released in 1998, Failla focuses on all types of Vitis vinifera from Syrah to Viognier. Chardonnay, though, holds a special place in the hearts of winemaker Ehren Jordan. The estate boasts eight different bottlings of the grape, with their Sonoma Coast cuvee being the gateway expression of multiple vineyard sites. The plot of land responsible for producing the majority of their Sonoma Coast bottlings lies on Olivet Road bordering the famed "Olivet Lane Vineyard." This vineyard site has been creating expressive and elegant examples of Chardonnay since 2013. Ehren is always one to experiment with different grapes, winemaking practices, and vineyard sites. We hope you enjoy one of California's finest bottlings of Chardonnay.

Piedmont Reds
Featured Barbera d'Alba
Brandini, 2021
In recent years, the Bagnasco sisters, Giovanna and Serena, have emerged in the Langhe, becoming champions of wines with freshness and elegance. In the words of Giovanna, "...we found the courage to be ourselves and start to make the wines we love the way we love to make them." Situated in the heart of the Barolo region in the small town of La Morra, they craft some of Piemonte's best expressions of Nebbiolo, Barbera, Dolcetto, Arneis, and Alta Langa. Finding Barberas with balance and beautiful aromatics is becoming more challenging in today's climate. Brandini sources their Barbera from a high-elevation vineyard just south of Monforte d'Alba, just outside the Barolo zone. The resulting wine expresses itself with brambly fruits, licorice, Salvadorian coffee, and violets.

"Alto Piemonte" & Other Piedmont Red
Featured Nebbiolo di Langhe
Aldo Conterno, "Il Favot", 2021
Aldo Conterno is often called the "King of Monforte," one of the true icons of Barolo. But not every masterpiece has to wait decades in the cellar. Il Favot is his love letter to Nebbiolo in its youth. Sourced from younger vines on the family's historic estate, the wine is aged in French oak for just the right touch of softness and spice. Instead of the brooding austerity you might expect from Barolo, here you'll find pure vibrancy: wild cherry, raspberry, rose petals, and a whisper of sweet spice. The tannins are silky and inviting, making this a Nebbiolo that charms immediately rather than testing your patience.Think of Il Favot as Nebbiolo dressed for the evening — graceful, approachable, and ready to dance across the table with your meal.

Barolo
Featured Barolo
Azelia, 2021
"Vigna Vecchie" (old vines) are something producers around the world yearn for, promote on their bottles, and charge you for. At Azelia, old vines are just a part of everyday life; you would never know it until you tasted their wines. The special magic that old vines gift the final wine is an extra layer of complexity that is hard to replicate. Since Lorenzo Scavino took the helm at Azelia, the wines have been nothing but elegant, aromatic, and showing a great sense of place. He sources his fruit from 50-year-old vines in the limestone-rich soils of Serralunga d'Alba and Castiglione Falletto, both communes of power and perfume. You can expect intense rose, violet, and cinnamon aromas with smoky minerality, pomegranate, and red currants.

"Le Menzioni" del Barolo
Featured "Le Menzioni" del Barolo
RPM PRESENTS: "LE MENZIONI" DEL BAROLO
In 2010 the Barolo region was officially demarcated and recognized for its 181 "Menzioni" (think "Premier Cru" and "Grand Cru" classifications in France). These designations celebrate the soulfully expressive characteristics of each site's diverse soils, varying altitudes, and unique grape growing typicity. Outside of the Cote de Nuits in Burgundy, there is perhaps no other region that is studied and dissected in greater detail than the zone of Barolo. We are excited to highlight these "terroir-driven" wines from some of the greatest producers and vintages.

Barbaresco
Featured "Le Menzioni" del Barbaresco
Bricco di Neive, Cigliuti, "Vie-Erte", 2019
Since the founding of Cigluiti in 1964, the winery's focus has always been quality over quantity. In Piedmont before the 1980s, it was sacrilegious to practice "green harvesting" or cutting grapes to concentrate the quality of the remaining grapes. Renato of Cigliuti was told by his neighbors he was throwing away money for green harvesting, and in his first vintage, he produced 300 bottles. Today, he and his daughters stand as one of the premier producers of Barbaresco that no one has ever heard of. Their Bricco di Neive hails from a small plot known as Vie Erte just outside of the town of Neive. Renato's approach has always been to let the terroir speak for itself in the glass through his mantra, "this blessed land." His Vie-Erte does just that by lending notes of bright red fruit, orange peel, white pepper, and mint that scream nuance and finesse.

The Wines of Angelo Gaja
Featured Producer
Angelo Gaja
Angelo Gaja is the man credited for bringing the small commune of Barbaresco out of obscurity. His influence has changed the way the world views Italian wine to this day. A master of Nebbiolo: the austere, tannic grape once considered only quaffable after decades of bottle age, Angelo saw its potential as a world-class wine. Despite pushback from his peers, he employed new (and what most considered outlandish) practices both in the vineyard and the winery to promote freshness and elegance in his wine. The story of Gaja is a truly fascinating one, but is best told through a glass of his stunning Barbaresco...(hint, hint).

Tuscan Red
Featured Chianti Classico
Istine, 2022
Novel thoughts don't come to mind when thinking about Chianti. Originally delimited in 1713 by Cosimo Medici III the original region between Siena and Florence is now known as: Classico. While the wines will always be intertwined with history; the Istine estate embraces their traditions while marrying modern technique and equipment in both the winery and the vineyard. The result is a wine that displays the qualities that made the region famous over three hundred years ago combined with luxury and balance from the lessons of modernity.

Featured Other Tuscan Red
Orcia Riserva, Fabbrica, "Tinia", 2020
There is a new age of producers in lesser-known areas of Tuscany that are taking Sangiovese to new heights. Tim Manning, UK expat and winemaker in Tuscany for decades, is a leader of this new age at Fabbrica Pienza. Fabbrica is in the Orcia DOC, just past the border of the famed region of Brunello di Montalcino. Fabbrica's Sangiovese is grown at high elevation on mineral-rich sandy-clayey soils reminiscent of soils in Crozes-Hermitage. Tim's winemaking is both classical and boundary-pushing, utilizing whole-cluster fermentations, very long macerations, and a mixture of concrete and large oak for aging. The Tinia Orcia Riserva Sangiovese, taken from two of the estate's best parcels, exudes finesse with haunting aromatics of rose petals, crunchy red cherry, strawberry, and fresh Tuscan herbs. This wine is the perfect balance of accessibility with a thought-provoking nature.

Brunello di Montalcino
Featured Brunello di Montalcino
Le Ragnaie, 2019
In recent years, top Brunello di Montalcino producers have sought high-altitude vineyards to capture Sangiovese's typicity in warmer vintages, purposefully preserving its varietal finesse. Le Ragnaie is fortunate to possess a coveted plot on some of the highest elevation vineyards, where they harness the sun's rays for a formidable and refined wine with fresh acidity – a rare achievement today. Le Ragnaie's Brunello embodies traditional flavors of sour cherry, wild strawberry, saddle leather, and tilled earth. The resulting wine is a more pronounced, luxurious bottling that only the region of Montalcino can provide.

Featured Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
Ventolaio, 2016
Brunello di Montalcino has risen to be the premier interpretation of Tuscan Sangiovese. At the Riserva level, it ranks among some of the highest aging requirements of any other table wine in the world. By law, it may not be released until the 6th year following harvest, and is mandated to mature in oak for a minimum of two years. Full in body, a Riserva designated Brunello expresses all the traditional flavors one expects from the varietal with an emphasis on black cherry, chocolate notes, and a dark earthiness. The resulting wine is a more pronounced, luxurious bottling that only the hill of Montalcino can provide.

"Super Tuscans"
Featured "Super Tuscan"
Tenuta di Carleone, "Uno", 2020
Lying at one of the highest points in Tuscany is the medieval hamlet of Castiglioni, where Tenuta di Carleone calls home. The hamlet's castle was erected in 1078 by monks, but it took almost 1000 years before wine began being produced here. This new venture is thanks to Karl Egger and Sean O'Callaghan, who partnered to focus on the esteemed Tuscan varietal: Sangiovese. Sean O'Callaghan also known as "Il Guericio" (one-eyed rascal) farms their twenty hectares of land and chooses only the oldest and best vines for the "Uno" bottling. It is considered the flagship of the estate and demonstrates the elegance of what a "Super Tuscan" can be. Some of the wine world's most respected minds have said, "Could this be Tuscany's answer to Haut Brion?"

Featured Bolgheri
Cipriana, "Vigna Scopaio 339", 2020
Cipriana is one of Bolgheri's quiet originals — family-run since 1975, long before the region became a buzzword. With just 14 hectares of estate vines, they focus on precision, tradition, and letting the land speak for itself. Their wines balance Mediterranean warmth with a grounded elegance, much like the people who make them. In a region of rising stars, Cipriana remains a steady light with deep roots. Their "Vigna Scopaio 339" is a single-vineyard expression of Cabernet Sauvignon captures the rugged charm of its namesake plot: structured, aromatic, and deeply rooted in place.

Veneto Reds
Featured Amarone della Valpolicella
Musella, 2018
Just outside of Verona lie the hills of Valpolicella which is home to one of Italy's greatest wines: Amarone. Composed of a blend of special, native varietals, Amarone's claim to fame is a result of its unique production method, appassimento. Directly translating to "withering" or "fading", appassimento refers to a special grape-drying process that concentrates the sugars and flavors in grapes destined for Amarone. Full-bodied and powerful with ripe fruit, these wines deliver a unique expression of Northern Italian wine.

Veneto Reds of Quintarelli & Dal Forno
Featured Producers
Quintarelli vs. Dal Forno
DRC vs. Leroy...Lafite vs. Latour...Conterno vs. Gaja... the wine geek's equivalent to a political debate (notwithstanding a little BS) in a quest for the single greatest expression of a particular wine. In Valpolicella, two producers indisputably reign at the top of the quality pyramid: Quintarelli and Dal Forno. Both producers commit maniacal attention to fruit selection, sorting down to the individual berry if necessary to achieve the best extraction of flavor possible. Quintarelli's genius in the cellar is carried out through more traditional methods of èlevage, while Dal Forno boasts one of the most technologically advanced wineries in the world. Preference in the resulting wines can be polarizing depending on the taster, but the quality of both is unquestionable. Where Quintarelli masterfully draws elegance and otherworldly aromas out of his Amarones, Dal Forno excels in achieving depths of concentration winemakers in Napa only dream about.

Featured Lombardia Red
Rosso di Valtellina, Ar.Pe.Pe., 2021
Just south of the Swiss border lies the sensational region of Valtellina. With vineyards terraced upon impossibly steep mountains, Valtellina is home to the best Nebbiolo outside of Piedmont. Here Nebbiolo is called "Chiavennasca" and produces one of Italy's most sophisticated reds. Positioned at a near 90 degree incline, mechanized farming is not an option here forcing grape farmers to look after each grape by hand. With high risk comes great reward in Valtellina and with one of the prized vineyards named Inferno, it becomes apparent how grape farmers feel about working at these heights.

Featured Abruzzo Red
Montepulciano d'Abruzzo, Tiberio, "Archivio", 2020
Cristiana Tiberio and her brother, Antonio, have transformed their small winery in the quaint village of Cugnoli, Abruzzo, from barren land to star status in under 20 years. With stints at producers like Jacques Selosse in Champagne, Nicolas Joly at Coulee de Serrant, Egon Muller in the Mosel, and multiple producers in Chablis, it is no wonder that Cristiana's wines are some of the best in Italy. She specializes in single vineyard, old vine, and special clone bottlings that express a distinct side of Abruzzo that not many capture. Her Archivio is meticulously crafted from massal selected 67-year-old vines from four special biotypes of Montepulciano. Archivio, translating to "archive," is a homage to these biotypes, and each is named after the Tiberio family's dogs: Tione, Quarmari, Diana, and Otto. The final wine produced exudes a distinct silky texture with tart raspberry and savory spice mingled with violet inner florals.

Sicily Red
Featured Etna
Etna Rosso, Girolamo Russo, "'a Rina", 2021
Famed winemaker Giuseppe Russo of Girolamo Russo has been instrumental in the recent surge in popularity of Mt. Etna wines. In his early years, Giuseppe had his eyes set on his career in music and literature. However, in 2004 he returned to his hometown of Passopisciaro to tend to his father's 18 hectares of 100-year-old vines planted to varietals native to Mt. Etna. He rose to fame within the region after studying under some of Etna's greatest producers: Frank Cornelissen, Marco de Grazia of Tenuta delle Terre Nere, and Andrea Franchetti of Passopisciaro. As a classically trained pianist, Giuseppe is no stranger to precision and focus. His spellbinding wines of extreme elegance and depth can only be created on the volcanic terroir of Mount Etna. His "'a Rina" bottling exudes bright red berries, sweet spice, and a faint hint of tobacco displaying the true essence of Mt. Etna.

American Pinot Noir
Featured Willamette Valley
Martin Woods, "Koosah", Eola-Amity Hills, 2022
Winemaker Evan Martin is humbly producing some of the greatest Pinot Noir found anywhere in the world. Like a virtuoso artist, Evan's discerning taste leads him to maniacally select only the highest of quality grapes, sourced from vineyard sites as rare and exceptional as they come. Enter his pièce de résistance, the illustrious "Koosah" vineyard bottling. The name "Koosah", derived from the dialect of the Coastal Salish people, evokes a sense of awe with its poetic translation, "beautiful ceiling in the sky," a fitting portrayal of its perch atop the crest of Eola-Amity Hills. Limited and exceptionally special, the '22 "Koosah" tantalizes the senses with notes of Alpine spices, macerated dark cherries, and a touch of reduced pomegranate leaving a lasting impression of indulgence and sophistication.

Other American Red
Featured Domestic Grenache
Pax, "Alder Springs", Mendocino County, 2021
Pax Mahle has always been focused on producing great wines from great vineyards. From the onset of his career he channeled his energies into sourcing the best fruit he could find and, if he couldn't, would farm it himself. After the success of his initial project, Pax and his wife Pam founded the eponymous Pax Cellars. Utilizing much of the same land for this label, he started to produce an entire range of wines focused on elegance, freshness, and Old World techniques. All his grapes are hand-harvested, foot-crushed, and fermented whole cluster–a nod to his favorite producers in the Rhone–and he has continued to innovate by farming Chenin Blanc, Trousseau Gris, Gamay, and Vermentino. Alder Springs is a site he has been working with since 2005 and produces exceptional fruit around the town of Laytonville, more reminiscent of the Rhône he draws inspiration from.

Dessert Wine
Featured Vin Santo del Chianti
Felsina, 2016
Literally translated "Holy Wine", Vin Santo has a rich history dating back to the heart of the Renaissance era. Using the unique passito method, grapes are dried out on straw mats to concentrate sugars and amplify complexity. Legend has it that a 14th century friar once used leftover Vin Santo from Mass to heal the sick. We're not guaranteeing a miracle, but might suggest that a glass of this 'enlightened spirit' can cure what ails you

Large Format
Featured Large Format Champagne & Franciacorta
Brut Nature Champagne, Barrat-Masson, "Les Margannes", 2016
Aurélie Barrat and Loïc Masson are a husband-and-wife team who toil over their seven hectares of vines in the small villages of Bethon and Villenauxe-la-Grande in the Côte de Sézanne region of Champagne. They farm organically and let their terroir speak for itself. Their "Les Margannes" comes from a single vineyard comprised of 40-year-old Chardonnay vines grown in classic chalky soils. The wine blossoms with lemon oil, honey, acacia, toasted bread notes, and hints of white flowers and oyster shells. Perfect for a large group or, in the loosely debaucherous words of Sir Winston Churchill, "A magnum is the perfect size for two people to share over lunch... especially if one of them isn't drinking".

Menu
Ambar Chicago offers you a wide variety of Balkan peninsula tastes and feelings.
Our unique approach to food, unparalleled service and world-famous Balkan Hospitality
are the key to make your every visit a special occasion.

n
u

Our Culinary ApproaCh
At Nic + Junior’s, our tasting menu in River North is one of four seasonal menus, each crafted to reflect the rhythm of the season and the way we love to host. Whether you’re joining us for lunch, a lively à la carte dinner, or a multi-course tasting in the back dining room, each dish is thoughtful, balanced, and rooted in flavor.
Our tasting menu is the cornerstone of Nic + Junior’s – an ever-evolving, multi-course journey that showcases peak-season ingredients and global inspiration in River North. Meanwhile, our à la carte menu delivers vibrant flavors perfect for lunch meetings, casual dinners, or drinks that turn into dessert.
Whether you’re here for a quick bite or a curated evening, we make every meal feel personal, elevated, and just indulgent enough.
Planning a private event?
Explore our group dining options.
Book Now
EXPLORE OUR Menus

✨ CHEF’S NIGHT OUT at Nic + Junior’s ✨
Whe
River North’s hidden gem ✨

From snacks to mar
A Curated Take on River North Dining
Nic + Junior’s offers a layered approach to
River North dining
, where each menu is crafted to reflect our Brazilian roots, Italian elegance, and a modern sense of hospitality. Whether you’re joining us for a quick weekday lunch or settling in for a full tasting experience, our menus are designed to inspire.
We begin daily at 11AM with our
lunch menu
, offering vibrant dishes that balance flavor, freshness, and finesse. From pão de queijo to seasonal entrées, our midday options are ideal for business lunches, casual meetups, or spontaneous solo visits. Monday through Friday from 4–6PM, we invite you to enjoy
happy hour
in the bar and lounge. Discover discounted cocktails, select wines, and shareable small plates—perfect for unwinding after work or easing into the evening. As night falls, explore our
à la carte dinner menu
, available in the main bar and lounge. These dishes are bold yet balanced, designed for flexibility and full of global influence—from handmade pastas to standout seafood and grilled meats. For a more immersive experience, reserve our
tasting menu
—a multi-course expression of Chef Junior Borges’ culinary perspective. Served in our intimate dining room, it’s a true celebration of the Nic + Junior’s philosophy: elegant, grounded, and deeply flavorful. At every time of day, Nic + Junior’s brings something distinct to the
River North dining
scene. We invite you to explore each offering below and find the experience that fits your mood, your appetite, or the moment.

Menus
When you visit a restaurant in Florence, Lucca or Livorno, you meet a constant in themes and traditions - handmade pasta, wood-fire cooking, and bistecca. Tre Dita is a place where those traditions can live in full illustration.
-Chef Evan Funke

Featured Half Bottle Bolgheri Rosso
Ca'Marcanda (Gaja), "Magari" 2022
Ca'Marcanda is the Gaja family's venture outside Piedmont, and Magari is one of its most celebrated wines. Magari blends Bordeaux varietals—Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Cabernet Franc—capturing the essence of the region's unique terroir and climate. The wine is prized for its rich, complex flavors, balancing ripe fruit, herbal notes, and a refined structure that makes it age well. It reflects a successful marriage of tradition and modern winemaking, appealing to a global audience and contributing to Bolgheri's reputation as a premier wine region, rivaling Bordeaux and Napa Valley

Featured Vintage Franciacorta
Ricci Curbastro, "Gualberto", Dosaggio Zero, 2013
Farming the land for eighteen generations, the family at Ricci Curbastro takes great pride in the grapes they grow and the wine they produce. A founding member of the Franciacorta appellation, they have believed in the power and finesse of the region for as long as it has been recognized. This profound respect for the land and deep care for the fruit shines through in every bottle. They are no strangers to the ageabilty and complexity that Franciacorta can provide - and now neither are you while enjoying this selection

Featured Vernaccia di San Gimignano
Montenidoli, "Fiore", 2023
The vineyards of Montenidoli are an uncontaminated land, high on the hill, which breathe in the purest air. Elisabetta Fagiuoli has been tending to the land here since 1965 when it was an untamed forest, untouched by man. Throughout her almost 60 years of winemaking here, she can only describe the experience as such: "I enjoy the truth of other places, but I am in this place and I'm making the wine of this terroir. I don't want to be similar to anybody else. I want to be better than myself." The "Fiore" cuvée of her signature Vernaccia di San Gimignano is the free run juice that escapes before any grapes are pressed, imprinting the cleanest expression possible

Featured Colli Tortonesi
Vigneti Massa,"Derthona", 2022
In the Colli Tortonesi DOC on the border of eastern Piemonte, Walter Massa single-handedly resurrected the Timorasso variety from extinction. Working in obscurity for years, Massa's determination is driven by his love, passion, and belief in the terroir of the region. Farming around 30 hectares near the partially abandoned hilltop town of Monleale Alto, the variety of the soils in his higher-elevation vineyards inform the complexity of this wine. Although he also produces top wines from Barbera, Nebbiolo, and Freisa as well, his 'Derthona' of 100% Timorasso is a world-class, benchmark example of this unique and beautiful wine

Featured Blanc de Morgex et de la Salle
Ermes Pavese, 2023
Ermes Pavese is a youthful grower in the commune of La Ruine just outside of the town of Morgex in the high Alps, mere minutes from the summit of Mont Blanc. Pavese works with the native grape known as Prié Blanc. Starting with barely two hectares of vineyards, situated at about 1200 meters above sea level, Pavese has gradually expanded his holdings in this high altitude zone (some of the highest altitudes of vineyards in Europe). He now produces three versions of Blanc de Morgex et de La Salle. Because these vineyards are so isolated, Pavese has been able to work with the original, pre-Phylloxera root stock since that malady never infiltrated this area when it came sweeping through Europe many years ago. The wine is austere, racy, and mineral driven with length

Featured Veneto Bianco
Venissa,"Venusa", 2019
Venissa was founded in 2002, when Gianluca Bisol saw a small vineyard in a garden in front of the Santa Maria Assunta Basilica, the oldest church in all of Venice, located on the island of Torcello. His curiosity was piqued and he began to carry out historical and agronomical research on the vines. He discovered that the Venetian islands had an important viticultural tradition up until 1966, the year the great flood destroyed the vineyards, causing all traces of this millennial tradition to be lost. The research he began led to the rediscovery of an indigenous variety, Dorona di Venezia, that had adapted to the salty conditions of the lagoon over the centuries. Thanks to a team of agronomists and experts in lagoon history, the last 88 vine plants that survived the flood were found. In the course of their research the experts met Gastone, a farmer who produced a small amount of wine for his family and used the traditional winemaking methods of the lagoon, including the long skin maceration that give Dorona its impressive longevity

Featured Abruzzo Bianco
Torre dei Beati, "Giocheremo", Pecorino, 2023
Located between the town of Pescara and the highest peak in the Apennine Mountains in the Abruzzo region, the estate derives its name 'Tower of the Blessed' from a 14th century mural in the local church. Fausto Albanese and his family believe that the beauty and quality of a wine cannot be separated from the vineyard. Certified organic since 2000, Albanese's ethos is a firm commitment to quality, producing wines from hand-harvested grapes which are selected using the strictest criteria. His 'Giocheremo' Pecorino is the result of many pickings in the vineyard, crafting the wine to express varietal purity in addition to six months on the lees. He and his family believe in leaving a lasting legacy of respect and care for the land for future generations and for the region

Featured Greco di Tufo
Mastroberardino, 2008
The Mastroberardino family are largely responsible for the revival and elevation of Irpinian and Campanian winemaking post WWII. Working primarily with Campania's ancient native varietals such as Fiano, Greco, and Aglianico, Mastroberardino has resuscitated into world class wines. One such example is Greco, a clone of the ancient Greco Bianco grape which was brought to Campania from Thessaly in Greece in the first century BC. It's named after the town of Tufo in Avellino where the grape thrives in soft volcanic rock that makes up the subsoil of the region. This rock imparts crystalline minerality to the wine's profile, and it is one of few white wines from the area with excellent aging potential

Featured Vermentino di Gallura
Surrau, "Sciala", 2023
'Gallura' translates to 'stony area' - and the granite-dominant soils of the Vermentino di Gallura DOCG on the windswept northeastern corner of Sardegna makes for one of the most important sites for Vermentino. Taking its name from the Surrau valley, the Demuro family have been making wine for generations. Nestled amongst rugged hills and near the Costa Smeralda, Tino Demuro and his team cultivate 20 hectares exclusively to Vermentino. The cuvée name 'Sciala' has its origins in Arabic, referring to generous fruit and an abundant harvest. With the grapes sourced and blended from his best sites, Demuro wishes to tell the story of the sun, sea, and wind of Gallura

Featured Chianti Classico Riserva
Fèlsina,"Rancia", 2020
In 1966, Domenico Poggiali Fèlsina realized the potential for quality Sangiovese in Chianti. With estates that have a history of viticulture dating back thousands of years, Fèlsina developed a team committed to quality and with a respect for tradition. The unique variety and complexity of the many clones of Sangiovese developed over decades in the vineyards are reflected in the quality, balance, consistency, and style of the final wines. The 'Rancia' vineyard takes its name from the historic Rancia farmhouse which was once a Benedictine monastery. Respect for tradition and the embrace of modern techniques makes this one of the finest examples of Chianti Classico Riserva in the region

Featured Region - Brunello di Montalcino
This section of our wine list is a true homage to the renowned region of Brunello di Montalcino, celebrating its rich history, unparalleled terroir, and the passionate winemakers that have elevated it to global acclaim. Every bottle selected represents the elegance, complexity, and aging potential that define the appellation. From esteemed, time-honored estates to rising stars pushing the boundaries of innovation, our collection showcases the finest expressions of Sangiovese Grosso, the grape that makes Brunello legendary. We are incredibly honored to receive the 2024 Leccio d'Oro award, a recognition that underscores our commitment to curating an exceptional selection of the wines of Montalcino. This accolade reflects our deep appreciation for the craftsmanship, tradition, and dedication that go into every vintage. It is with great pride that we share these extraordinary wines with our guests, allowing them to experience the true essence of Tuscany

Featured Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
Salcheto, "Salco", 2005
Founded in 1984 as a classic multi-crop farm, Salcheto is now a vineyard of over 60 hectares of organically farmed grapes, operating in one of the most ecologically advanced wine cellars. The winery has a strong commitment to environmental sustainability through organic practices, energy independence, and carbon footprint reduction initiatives. So much so, that Salcheto is the first winery to certify the carbon footprint of a bottle of wine. Salcheto's "cult wine" is Salco, which come from the oldest vines of the vineyard. Created from a clone of Sangiovese Prugnolo Gentile that reaches slight overripeness, it spends 2 years in wood, and ages 4 more years in bottle. Stylistically, it's rich and round, exhibiting notes of plum, black cherry, wild Tuscan herbs, and minerality

Featured Barolo
Malvirá, 2013
When Giuseppe Damonte started to produce wine in the 50's at the family winery, he had a dream: to bottle the soul of the land that he loved, to be discovered sip by sip. In 1989, the winery Malvirà was moved to the current location at the foot of the S.S. Trinità vineyard and taken over by Giuseppe's grandchildren. Although the family is famous for their beautiful Roero wines, this small vineyard at the limit of Brunate fell into their capable hands. It was thanks to their older sister Gianna, and her marriage to a man from La Morra, that they became owners of a small piece of land in Barolo where these grapes are grown

Featured Barbaresco Riserva
Cascina Baricchi, "Rose delle Casasse", 2017
Cascina Baricchi is a unique estate in that, to our knowledge, is the only producer of a Barbaresco made one hundred percent from the Nebbiolo Rosé clone. Half of the vineyard's vines in Neive date back to 1913, and Nebbiolo vines this old are almost non-existent. This wine is truly a treasure of the area. The winery itself is in a small village called Neviglie which is actually just outside of the official Barbaresco zone, though given the quality of the vineyards and their historical importance, Baricchi is grandfathered in to be allowed to bottle his wine as Barbaresco

Featured Gattinara
Vallana, 2020
A pioneer in the region that put Gattinara on the map, Antonio Vallana and his 17 year-old son Bernardo started the winery in 1937 in the town of Maggiora 100 miles northeast of the Langhe. Nebbiolo, known here as Spanna, finds incredible expression in Alto Piemonte, with Bernardo making world-class wines that rival the best of Barolo and Barbaresco. The sixth generation of Francis and Marina Fogerty carry on the tradition of sustaining family traditions and a commitment to excellence, regardless of trends. The single village appellation of Gattinara DOCG sits on a unique UNESCO geo-site of ancient volcanic soils, creating exceptional conditions for viticulture. The Vallanas believe their wines and others from Alto Piemonte to be "unum, verum, bonum" - one, true, and good

Prà, "Morandina", 2017
Graziano Pra had a calling to become a vine grower, and it's a road he followed with commitment and honesty. He says: "I admire wine, I respect it, and try to bring out what is already written in the soil it is born in and grows in. To grow, to give, to be." Winemaker Michele Moschioni's statement of purpose informs the generosity with all that he does on his family estate of many generations in the Colli Orientali del Friuli DOC in northeastern Italy. Using organic, hand-harvested grapes with indigenous yeasts, Michele and his son Valentino, wife Sabrina, and daughter Alessia insist on the importance and toughness of family to produce world-class wines that have no equal. Setting a new standard for quality and terroir expression with the Schioppettino grape, Michele is a trailblazer in the region, recognized the world over. Featured Sforzato di Valtellina
Nino Negri, 2019
In the amphitheater of the steep terraced slopes facing the majestic Alps in the Lombardia region, the Nino Negri family have been making concentrated, yet elegant wines from Nebbiolo for over 125 years. The grapes - here called Chiavennasca - receive intense sunlight and the 'Breva' wind sweeps the Adda Valley from Lake Como, allowing for full ripening and fresh fruit in these thousand year-old stone terraces. Hand harvested with scrupulous care, the grapes are dried through the autumn and winter, pressed, and then aged in French oak barrels. This process reveals one of the most singular and unique expressions of Nebbiolo in the world. As one of Italy's most decorated estates, Nino Negri's benchmark Sforzato di Valtellina is recognized around the world for its high quality, power, and finesse

Featured Montefalco Sagrantino
Cantina Fratelli Pardi, "Sacrantino", 2018
Cantina Fratelli Pardi's story begins in 1919 with three brothers, Alfredo, Francesco and Alberto. The winery was, then, located on the ground floor of the San Marco Hospital that resided within Saint Francis in Montefalco. White and red wines were both produced, but it was the Sagrantino based wines that became the stars of the region. These wines were sold all over Umbria, and eventually all over Italy, even to eminent places such as the Vatican. In 2002 the founders' great grandsons, driven by the will of the Pardi family to keep tradition, restored the building in Montefalco and revived their great-grandfathers' winery. Today the brothers Alberto Mario and Gianluca Rio, with their enthusiasm and hard work, are the new era of the Pardi wine's legacy

Featured Aglianico Del Vulture
Re Manfredi, 2018
On the slopes of the extinct Monte Vulture volcano which rises to 4,300 feet in the region of Basilicata, the Re Manfredi estate sits on some of the most unique volcanic soils in continental Europe. Considered a benchmark producer in the region, the Montrone family have been making some of the top expressions of Aglianico since 1998. In addition to the warm, dry climate, the volcanic terroir imparts a minerality to the wine not found elsewhere in Italy. Sourced from over 50 hectares of estate vineyards of over 30 yearold vines, Re Manfredi has been recognized internationally for its quality and unique expression of Aglianico

Featured Cerasuolo di Vittoria Classico
Azienda Agricola COS, 2022
Seeking to respect the land with humility, hard work, and patience, three friends founded Azienda Agricola COS in 1980 and were the youngest wine producers in Italy: Giambattista Cilia, Cirino Strano and Giusto Occhipinti. They received an old family winery from Giambattista Cilia's father Giuseppe Cilia and the nearby vineyard of bush trained vines in the famed town of Bastonaca. In 2005, they made the first wine that bore the Denominazione d'Origine Controllata e Garantita (D.O.C.G.) designation, the only one in Sicily. Today, COS is associated not only with the success of Cerasuolo di Vittoria but also with rigor and quality. The region was reborn, and the area around Vittoria is thriving with its extraordinary wines

Featured Jeroboam
Montevertine, "Le Pergole Torte", Toscana, 2019
"Le Pergole Torte" is possibly Tuscany's most famed Sangiovese wine. Ironically, even though it is made within a well-known appellation like Chianti Classico, it doesn't wear the DOCG "fascetta" seal or the historical black rooster emblem. Sergio Manetti, the owner of the Montevertine estate, was ahead of his time. In the 70's and 80's, the Chianti region was nowhere close to wanting to let go of age-old traditions (blending white varietals with Sangiovese), yet suffered from an ever-worsening poor reputation. With this, Sergio voiced that Sangiovese could be made as a single varietal wine. He was booed by this rebellious notion and had to carry on without the consensus of his peers. He left the Chianti appellation in 1981 and continued his pursuit to produce fine wine using only his own small farm's brand. This quest paid off as his pure Sangiovese "Le Pergole Torte" became a cult phenomeon. Sergio passed away in 2001 and his son Martino continues his father's legacy today

Steakhouse Menu
Appetizers

Two classic Maryland Crab cakes, perfectly seasoned.

and fried to perfection. Served on top of marina sauce.

Creamy bisque enriched with blended succulent lobster meat and a hint of brandy

French onion soup baked with a crust of melted Swiss cheese and garlic crouton

Cheese-filled tortellini simmered in a flavorful beef broth.
Entrees
OUR PRIME STEAKS HAVE AGED A MINIMUM OF 28 DAYS FOR OPTIMUM TENDERNESS. ENTREES SERVED WITH HOUSE SALAD.
Filet Mignon 8oz/ 12oz
The pinnacle of tenderness, expertly grilled to your liking
New York Strip Steak 14oz
A classic choice, robust in flavor and perfectly aged

The ultimate indulgence, featuring both strip and tenderloin cuts

Skirt Steak 10oz

Two center-cut pork chops grilled to perfection, accompanied by applesauce

Cold water lobster tail paired with a tender filet mignon, a timeless combination

Creamy mashed potatoes infused with roasted garlic and fresh herbs

Baked potato slices layered in a rich cream sauce, topped with Parmesan cheese

Baked potato filled with creamy mashed potatoes

Tender mushrooms sautéed in butter and aromatic sherry wine

Sweet onions, slowly caramelized to perfection

Tender asparagus spears steamed and served with hollandaise sauce

Fresh broccoli florets steamed to crisp-tender perfection
Sauteed Spinach
Fresh sautéed spinach
Fresh Seafood
Stuffed Atlantic Salmon

Chilean Sea Bass*
Grilled Chilean Sea bass adorned with fresh diced tomatoes, basil, and a splash of white wine
Zuppa Di Pesce*
A seafood lover’s delight, assorted, seafood and linguine pasta
Alaskan King Crab Legs - MP
served with drawn butter and lemon
Cold Water Lobster Tail
Cold Water Lobster Tail served with drawn butter and lemon
Mediterranean-Crusted Grilled Halibut
Perfectly grilled halibut with a flavorful Mediterranean herb crust, served with creamy mashed potatoes and tender grilled asparagus. Finished with a vibrant Mediterranean sauce
Chicken
Chicken Vesuvio
Herb-roasted boneless chicken breast served with garlic-infused roasted potatoes and peas
Chicken Lemon
Tender boneless chicken breast sauteed to perfection and finished with a refreshing lemon herb sauce
Chicken Piccata
Sautéed chicken breast in a lemon caper sauce
Chicken Marsala
Sautéed chicken breast with mushrooms in a Marsala wine sauce
Veal
Veal Lemon
Tender veal medallions sautéed in a lemon butter sauce served atop a bed of spinach
Veal Picatta
Veal cutlet delicately sautéed in a lemon caper sauce served with your choice of side
Veal Vesuvio
Veal medallions cooked with garlic, white wine, and Italian herbs, accompanied by roasted potatoes
Veal Marsala
Veal cutlet delicately sautéed with mushrooms in a Marsala wine reduction
Pasta
Homemade Gnocchi Pesto
Ricotta cheese-based homemade gnocchi tossed in a basil pesto sauce, finished with Parmesan cheese
Tortellini Veneto
Cheese-filled tortellini with prosciutto, peas, and mushrooms in a creamy tomato sauce
Pappardelle Scampi Primavera
Homemade pappardelle pasta tossed with succulent shrimp, seasonal vegetables, and
a hint of garlic
Penne Asiago
Penne pasta tossed with chicken, sautéed mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, onions, and a creamy white Asiago sauce.
Linguini Mussels
Linguine pasta served with fresh mussels in red or white sauce.
Homemade Lobster Cappellacci
Homemade cappellacci pasta stuffed with tender lobster meat in a creamy lobster sauce with shrimp, asparagus, mushrooms and cherry tomatoes.
Gnocchi Ai Quattro Formaggi
Ricotta cheese-based homemade gnocchi covered in a rich blend of Parmigiano, Asiago, Bleu cheese, and fresh mozzarella.
Desserts
Tiramisu
Classic Italian dessert made with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cream.
Homemade Creme Brulee
Creme brulee is a rich, creamy custard dessert topped with a layer of hardened caramelized sugar. Its smooth vanilla-infused base contrasts perfectly with the crisp, golden topping.
Chocolate Fudge Cake
A rich, moist dessert layered with dense, fudge chocolate and topped with a smooth, decadent chocolate ganache.
Turtle Cheesecake
Creamy, decadent dessert topped with rich caramel, crunchy pecans, and a smooth chocolate over a classic cheesecake base.
Homemade Tres Leches
A light and airy sponge cake saturated in a rich combination of three types of milk that makes it extremely moist. Finished with a layer of Italian mirror caramel.

About the Business
Business owner information
Gina C.
Business Owner
Escape the hustle and bustle of the Loop and step into The Village, a Chicago tradition since 1927 where generations of Chicagoans have enjoyed classic Italian-American specialities under the 'twinkling lights'.

Italian immigrant Alfredo Capitanini began his American Dream as a dishwasher and ended up building a monumental restaurant paying homage to his Northern Italian roots with dishes inspired and adapted from his hometown of Lucca in the foothills of Tuscany.

For the last 90+ years, The Village has stood as a bastion of Italian-American tradition and exuberance. With over 1,200 wines to choose from, we know you'll find something to fill your cup.

Come raise a glass and celebrate life with us! Salute!

Nora
Mediterranean restaurant & bar in Streeterville Chicago
Order Now
Book Now
Step into
Nora Restaurant & Bar
Where the name âNoraâ evokes centuries of Mediterranean culture and culinary tradition. Located in Chicagoâs vibrant Streeterville neighborhood, Nora blends the warmth of the Mediterranean with modern flairâinviting you to enjoy a memorable dining experience.
Learn More
Order
Mediterranean Cuisine
Today!
Experience the best of Italian and Mediterranean cuisine at Nora, located in the heart of Chicago. Enjoy seamless online ordering for delivery or takeout, bringing our delicious dishes right to your doorstep.
Start Your Order
Customer Reviews
Check out our most recent reviews!
Camisha D
Incredible Mediterranean spot. We ate outside, but they have a very spacious indoor area. The service was incredibly attentive. Order the calamari, probably one of the best I've had. For my main I had the Angolotti which had the most tender short rib. For my drink I had a non-alcoholic peach spritz which was
...
refreshing and not too sweet
Read More
Chris Fill
The best service hands down! My wife and I were staying across the street at another hotel and we went to Noraâs for an evening glass of wine, which turned into me having their Baklava and my wife having their Seada which are both amazing deserts.
The service at Noraâs was especially on par with the entire staff
...
really showing that they care about their patrons.
Also I forgot to mention after having desert we ordered two of their Americano coffees which were delicious. We crossed the street to visit Noraâs twice while we were here in Chicago visiting and will definitely be back when we come back to the Chi again.
Thanks Nora for the hospitality!
Read More
Alex & Angela Cutillo
We had an amazing lunch on Sunday around 2:00.
The inside of the restaurant is really cute. Service was smooth and the food was amazing.
As an Italian I will say their pasta dishes were really high value and well cooked. Portions are also pretty big.

We loved everything we ate, cannot recommend this place enough!
Lady Abbo
We had a wonderful date night in the Windy City! The food selections were regionally influenced by the Mediterranean and spanned across the flavor pallette. We enjoyed a unique appetizer and inspiring main courses. We left with happy tummies and satisfied taste buds. We look forward to another visit.
Nora Khanoba
I've had it on my bucket list for a while largely because it's a namesake, and it did not disappoint. The service was the best part of my visit and they kept on top of things, clearing and cleaning in-between the courses, refilling drinks etc. The food was great too, and came out on time. I highly recommend the
...
grilled octopus appetizer. I was celebrating as well, so we got a free dessert, which I really appreciated. 10/10 would recommend and would come back to again.
Read More
Grace Zhanel
The cuisine is more eclectic than I imagined, the seafood was wonderful. We got the branzino and seafood pasta. Our app was seafood kebab. Love everything we had here! The aesthetic was so pretty
Leah Nagy
After a walking Murder Mystery tour in Chicago, this place was a welcome and refreshing treat!

The atmosphere is so neat - beautiful decorations on the ceiling, patterned tile on the floor, mood lighting, etc. The food is delicious ð¤¤ I canât recall what my friends ordered, but my tuna tartare was soooooo
...
goooood.

One of of party has a dairy allergy and is sensitive to gluten, and our waitress just told her to tell her what she would like and they would check with the kitchen. They were able to make her food without butter and ensuring there was no cross contamination. She was so relieved!

There did seem to be some confusion on who our waitress was but it all sorted out in the end.

Highly recommend you to stop in and give this place a try!
Read More
Aimee Krause
My husband and I went to Chicago with two other couples because our high school kids were performing in the St. Patrickâs Day Parade on Saturday. One couple and ourselves stayed at Hotel Riu next door to this place and the third couple stayed in this hotel. After a day on the streets taking in the sites and having
...
food and drinks around town we decided to stop in and have a night cap here. We got so much more than that when we met our mixologist behind the bar, Pedro. He went above and beyond to customize drinks for each of the six of us without hesitation, had great conversations about the drinks as he was making them and knocked it out of the park every time. Our last night in Chicago we had to go visit one last time and we had some appetizers, some amazing drinks again created by the best of the best, Pedro who has more passion about what he does than just making drinks behind a bar, he loves what he does and takes so much pride in every pour. We met the manager, Nick who was extra accommodating, brought great conversation to our group, shared in our laughs, made sure we were having another great time and invited us to come back the next time weâre in town to visit. Then to sweeten our last night there even more the chef/owner was introduced to our group when we were about to leave and the head pastry chef complimented our table with four of the most beautiful hand crafted delicious desserts. Nora is forever on our radar when visiting Chicago in the future, love the place, the staff, and the city. Thank you Nora for making all of us small town Ohio couples feel so welcome and special in the great City of Chicago!
Read More
Devin Singh
Nora offers a dining experience that's both intimate and vibrant. The restaurant's modern decor, combined with its warm lighting, creates an inviting atmosphere perfect for a nice night out. Standout dishes include the seared scallops and the truffle risotto, each bursting with flavor and expertly prepared. The
...
service is attentive and knowledgeable, enhancing the overall experience
Read More
Carrington Moore
When I arrived to Chicago for work on Friday night, I was looking for a quick bite before heading to bed & beginning a busy weekend/week. Nora was across the street from my hotel and looked immediately inviting.  I was welcomed by extremely friendly staff, a beautiful environment, and an interesting, unique
...
menu.

Chicago is full of amazing restaurants, but I came back to Nora every single night.  Each dish inexplicably better than the last, I made my way through a number of items on their menu (& wish I had time for more).

Gorgeous plating, phenomenal food, perfect wine list, and a knowledgeable staff that can explain and guide you through an exceptional meal. The attentive GM, Omar, even reserved a seat at the bar for me on my fourth & final night knowing I would be back.

Pedro, Dallas, Chef and the rest of the Nora team - thank you so much for several amazing dining experiences. You are officially my favorite restaurant in Chicago.
Read More
Nora Restaurant & Bar
Join us at Streeterville for delicious meals.

Terms And Conditions
Terms and Conditions for attending WINE DINNERS:
To provide you with a better experience at our special wine-tasting and dinner events, we have improved the registration process. Please take note of the following terms when making your reservation:
Registration and Confirmation:
Access to event registrations will be open from the publication of the event flyer until the maximum capacity of attendees is reached or 12 hours prior to the event.
Upon submitting your request to attend an event, you will receive an email confirming your successful reservation, as well as a unique and non-transferable registration number.
To guarantee your spot, we will contact you by phone to confirm your attendance at the event of your choice.
Waiting List:
If the event you are interested in is already full, don’t worry, you still have a chance to attend. Simply register and you will immediately receive an email confirming that you are on the waiting list. In case of a cancellation, we will contact you so that you can attend.
Attendance:
We kindly ask that you arrive on time, as a sign of respect for our staff’s time and for other attendees. Each event will have a maximum tolerance time of 10 minutes before starting, to allow entry for those on the waiting list.
Coverage:
To provide a better service, Buona Terra covers some events to share them with the public through its website and social media. By registering and attending one of these events, you agree that your image may appear on their website and social media.

WHAT’S NEW
SABORES DE PRIMAVERA
We’re making the most of the season’s gorgeous produce and flavors.
Meet our newest dishes doing just that with plenty of Spanish spirit!
PAELLA DE VERDURAS
Bomba rice, eggplant, broccoli, peas, grape tomatoes, piquillo peppers, saffron, salsa verde
ATÚN CANARIO
Ahi Tuna crudo, avocado, red onion, diced cucumber, cilantro lime marinade
ESPÁRRAGOS CON ROMESCO
Grilled asparagus with romesco
CREMA CATALANA
creamy citrus custard

MINI HAMBURGUESA
2 sliders, sobrasada-bacon jam, crispy manchego cheese, garlic allioli
PATATINAS
Sweet and spicy house-made potato chips, whipped miti crema
BOCATA DE JAMÓN
Crispy baguette, 18 month aged Serrano ham, Manchego cheese, tomaquet, served with house-made potato chips and garlic allioli

Our Menu
Request “Quatro Portale” for all four courses (antipasti, primi, secondi, and dolci) - the menu is specially priced!
Ask about the daily additions to the menu.
Call (773) 489.4895 to place your order.
Antipasti
Considered an hors d' oeuvre to be had before pasta.
Assortment of Hand-Crafted Cured Meats 18

Club Lucky Inc. makes every attempt to identify ingredients that may cause allergic reactions for guests with food allergies. About
We like food. We like people. We like feeding people food. We promise not to make people into food. We promise to make simple, delicious (slightly cheffy) food for people to eat. We promise to be ready with the wine should the people want it. We don’t have room for a lot of people, so, people please, make your reservations early. People.

Private Events
We’d love to host your private event! With a 45 person capacity, our dining room is perfect for an intimate celebration with small bites or a seated family-style dinner, suited to your tastes. Buy outs are generally booked three months in advance.
We also have a covered patio with seating up to 20 persons, which may be booked for full, or partial night buy outs. The patio is open April – October.
Our 45-person dining room at 3209 West Armitage Ave. in Logan Square, Chicago.

Menu
Experience Roma in Chicago!
Mangia! Mangia!
(if you have 6 or more)…
Read More
For parties of six or more we offer the “Mangia, Mangia” dinner. It’s a communal dining experience served family style for the table to share.  You simply tell us what you don’t like or are allergic to, and we will do the rest.  Depending on what is on the menu and the market for the day we’ll prepare you a multi-course meal for your group to enjoy.  Fabio’s menu will include: anitpasti, bruschetta, salads, marinated eggplant, polentas, and pastas. “Mangia, Mangia” is $47 per person, and we can assure you that we will not let you leave hungry.  Servers will gladly pair wines with your meal, giving you more time with your group, less time figuring out what to eat.  To dine mangia: simply notify your server when you arrive, or fill out the Mangia form (click here) to guarantee a seating in advance.  Email: fsorano@gmail.com to make a mangia reservation or call (773) 772-7700 and give us your info over the phone.  Please keep in mind that we can accomodate groups of 4 or 5 for a bit more.  For parties of more than 30 people please email us for more information on our private party packages.

Book a Private Event
Find the perfect location
From professional events to family gatherings, we can help you find the perfect Rosebud Restaurant for your event. Our comfortable private dining rooms are perfect if you’re planning a business lunch, a cocktail party, a baby shower, bar mitzvah, a wedding reception, or even a corporate buyout.
Private Events
Our Menus
Century-Old, Italian Recipes
Rosebud Restaurants are known for serving generous portions of hospitality & quality Italian fare. Every meal is prepared to order with authentic 100-year-old recipes, giving you a taste of a real ‘Red Sauce’ experience!
Catering
Our off-premise capabilities are limitless
Rosebud Catering & Events takes the rich flavors of Rosebud tradition beyond the familiar atmosphere of our restaurants to parties and events throughout the Chicago metropolitan area. We guarantee to bring the same quality and excitement of the ‘Rosebud Experience’ to your special events.
Catering
News & Events
View All News & Events
Join Us for the Taylor Street Little Italy Festival
Read More
Rosebud on Taylor Street is Now Open!
Read More
Mia Rosebud in the Boca Observer Power Players
Read More
Our Story
For nearly half of a century, Rosebud Restaurants have been bringing classic Italian food to Chicago and the surrounding suburbs. Each location embodies authenticity, exceptional quality, and impeccable service—hallmarks that have set the industry standard. Founded by visionary restaurateur Alex Dana, Rosebud Restaurants have built a beloved family of establishments woven into the very fabric of Chicago, reflecting a legacy that continues to shape the city’s rich cultural and culinary landscape.
Our Story
From our kitchen to your doorstep, we’ve packed every bite with the same love and tradition that’s been filling family tables for generations. ❤️
Your comfort food, ready to go. Tap the link in bio to order lunch.

About
Our chefs specialize in authentic and delicious food. The staff at Simply Pasteur is devoted to serving customers mouthwatering dishes that feature the highest quality ingredients available. Simply Pasteur uses only the freshest ingredients around, ensuring that every dish is of the highest possible quality. Not sure what you're in the mood for? Try one of our specialties including Soup-xtra herbs/veg. , Soup-xtra herbs/veg., SAIGON CREPE, JASMINE RICE, and more.

Menu
Everything's made to order
Menu
Everything's made to order
The Whiteboard Menu
The Whiteboard Menu
Updated on a daily basis
Updated on a daily basis
We donât plan menus months in advanceâwe write them on a whiteboard by hand every day. What we cook depends on whatâs fresh at the market, whatâs in season, and what feels just right. Whether itâs a timeless Italian dish or a brand-new creation from Frank himself, everything we make starts with good ingredients and a love for honest food.
We donât plan menus months in advanceâwe write them on a whiteboard by hand every day. What we cook depends on whatâs fresh at the market, whatâs in season, and what feels just right. Whether itâs a timeless Italian dish or a brand-new creation from Frank himself, everything we make starts with good ingredients and a love for honest food.
Our Regulars' Favorites
Our menu may shift daily, but some dishes have earned permanent places in our guestsâ hearts. These are the ones people ask for by nameâflavorful, comforting, and made with the same love every time.
And if you have dietary restrictionsâgluten-free, vegetarian, vegan, or lactose-freeâjust let us know. Weâre happy to accommodate and cook something just right for you.
Osso Buco
Osso Buco
The answer to the question "What's your most popular dish?" hasn't changed in a few decades. Our decadent Osso Buco dissolves off the bone into a creamy bed of risotto.
The answer to the question "What's your most popular dish?" hasn't changed in a few decades. Our decadent Osso Buco dissolves off the bone into a creamy bed of risotto.
Roasted Salmon
Roasted Salmon
We have several options for seafood lovers, like our perfectly roasted salmon with fresh avocado, bright, juicy tomatoes, and a hint of heat from jalapeÃ±os.
We have several options for seafood lovers, like our perfectly roasted salmon with fresh avocado, bright, juicy tomatoes, and a hint of heat from jalapeÃ±os.
Chicken Vesuvio
Chicken Vesuvio
Juicy, bone-in chicken roasted to golden perfection and served with seasonal vegetables, all roasted together to give you a true Italian-American comfort dish.
Juicy, bone-in chicken roasted to golden perfection and served with seasonal vegetables, all roasted together to give you a true Italian-American comfort dish.
Sausage Rigatoni
Sausage Rigatoni
Rigatoni tossed with housemade Italian sausage, peppery arugula, and a light tomato sauce, finished with shaved Asiago cheese. Itâs a perfect balance of bold and fresh.

Capri Ristorante Burr Ridge
CAPRI RISTORANTE OF BURR RIDGE LUNCH MENU
APPETIZERS
Bruchetta Calabrese
Toasted crostini bread topped with fresh seasoned tomato and parmesan cheese
Caprese
Caprese  
sliced tomato topped with fresh mozzarella topped with basil and balsamic vinaigrette
add Prosciutto Di Parma
Grilled Seafood Platter
octopus, shrimp and calamari grilled and served over mixed greens topped with a balsamic vinaigrette
Calamari Capri
lightly breaded calamari pan seared with calamari tossed in a lemon garlic oil sauce with chili flake
Fried Calamari
lightly breaded and pan seared calamari served with a side of marinara
Grilled Calamari
grilled calamari served on a bed of mixed greens topped with lemon vinaigrette
Wise Guys Meatballs
Meatballs tossed in vodka sauce served with a scoop of ricotta cheese and giardiniera
SALADS
Capri Summer Salad
Capri Summer Salad
Arugula tossed in a garlic dressing topped with a creamy centered burrata cheese and fresh berries drizzled with a fig jam
Salmon Salad
Fresh baby spinach tossed in a creamy roasted Italian dressing with red roasted peppers shaved almonds, and red onions topped with grilled salmon
Santa Lucia
Field greens tossed in a raspberry vinaigrette with prosciutto bits, sun dried tomatoes, red onions and gorgonzola cheese
Cold Tuna Italian Salad
genoa tuna tossed   in a lemon olive oil dressing with cannelloni beans, green beans, and red onions
Steak Salad
field greens tossed in balsamic dressing with tomatoes, carrots,  onions,  and   perreroncini topped with sliced grilled ribeye steak
Mama’s Meatball Salad
fresh greens, cucumber, tomatoes and sliced onions tossed in our special dressing topped with a scoop of ricotta and meatballs in marinara sauce
Blackened Mediterranean Chicken Salad
romaine tossed in a lemon vinaigrette with red onion, feta, Kalamata olives, and pepperoncini topped with blackened chicken breast strips
Grilled Chicken Caesar Salad
romaine tossed in Caesar dressing with grilled chicken, shaved Parmesan and croutons
Capri Chopped Salad
Chopped romaine, tomato, cucumber, carrots, black olives, red onion, corn, feta cheese, walnuts and crispy  prosciutto tossed in our special chopped salad house dressing
VEGETARIAN
Eggplant Parmesan
Thinly sliced, breaded and pan seared eggplant layered and baked with mozzarella cheese and marinara sauce served with pasta
PASTA
Gluten free pasta available upon request
Homemade Rigatoni Vodka
round tubular pasta sautéed in our famous vodka sauce
Gnocchi Bolognese
handmade potato dumplings sautéed in meat sauce
Penne Arrabiata
penne pasta sautéed  in a spicy red sauce with prosciutto
Meat Lasagna
layers of pasta, cheese and ground meat baked with mozzarella and meat sauce
Jim Thome’s Home-Run Pasta
Cheese tortellini pasta sautéed in an alfredo sauce with peas, mushrooms, and prosciutto topped with sliced blackened chicken
Cavatelli with Spinach
handmade dumplings sautéed in a garlic and olive oil sauce with sundried tomatoes, spinach, and ricotta cheese
Stuffed Shells
jumbo pasta stuffed with ricotta cheese and baked with mozzarella and  marinara sauce
Fettucini Alfredo with Chicken
handmade fettucini pasta, sautéed in a creamy  alfredo sauce with chopped chicken
Linguini with Clams
Pasta sautéed with tender whole clams in your choice of a red or white sauce
Linguini with Shrimp
Pasta sautéed in a marinara sauce with Jumbo Shrimp
VEAL & CHICKEN
Veal Limone
veal medallions sautéed in a lemon sauce served with a side of pasta marinara.
Veal Parmesan
lightly breaded pan seared & baked with mozzarella and marinara sauce served with pasta
Veal Marsala
sautéed in a sweet marsala wine sauce with mushrooms served with a side of pasta marinara
Chicken Limone
chicken breast sautéed in a lemon sauce served with a side of pasta marinara
Chicken Parmesan
lightly breaded chicken breast pan seared & baked with mozzarella and marinara sauce served with pasta
Chicken Marsala
sautéed in a sweet marsala wine sauce with mushrooms served with a side of pasta marinara
Chicken Forget About It
Pounded, breaded and  pan seared chicken breast  topped with tomatoes, onions, black olive salad tossed in basil in a balsamic
PANINI & SANDWICHES
Chicken with Roasted Red Pepper Panini
Grilled chicken breast, tomato, red roasted red pepper & mozzarella cheese served with steak fries
Steak with Asiago Panini
thinly sliced grilled steak  caramelized onions, tomato and asiago cheese served with steak fries
Big Guy Sandwich
meatballs, provolone, marinara sauce served with steak fries
Papas Italian Sausage Sandwich
grilled sausage, sweet peppers and marinara sauce served with steak fries
Chicken Parmesan Sandwich
breaded chicken breast, mozzarella cheese and  marinara sauce served with steak fries

NOW AVAILABLE FOR PURCHASE - order online or swing by!
MICHELIN GUIDE
2 0 2 4
bib gourmand
MICHELIN Guide’s Point Of View
Bib Gourmand: good quality, good value cooking
This laid-back neighborhood spot is not to be underestimated. The unfussy dining room, which is often full, is balanced by a serious kitchen where chefs deploy top-rate ingredients and carefully manage puffy, charred Roman-style pizzas cooked in electric deck ovens. Oblong in shape and perfect for solo diners, the pies have a fantastic, bubble-like crunch to them; a favorite is the diavola sbagliata, which pairs spicy Italian salami, spicy Italian honey and smoked scamorza. And whereas some pizzerias have only one talent, this one also has a keen hand with pastas, all of which are made in-house. Think tagliatelle tossed with basil pesto, ravioli stuffed with roasted eggplant and a squid ink spaghetti cooked with clams and white wine.
———————————————————————————

Prosecco â Flor (Veneto) Dry with a touch of acidity, Pear and citrus on the palate.
â
Sparkling Rose (Pinot Noir) â Markus Huber (Weinland, Austria) Dry and Acidic, Medium Body. Fresh strawberry, melon, and subtle tastes of yeast.
White
Chardonnay â (Sonoma) Sonoma-Loeb. This medium-bodied white wine offers light aromatics with subtle minerality and a hint of herbaceousness. A gentle touch of oak adds depth, complementing the savory, slightly umami-rich flavors on the palate. With a well-rounded profile and moderate acidity, itâs a versatile wine ideal for dishes with umami or roasted flavors.
â
Riesling â (Nierstein/Rhein) Louis Guntrum. This lively white wine bursts with aromas of honey, wildflowers, and tropical pineapple. On the palate, itâs bright and balanced, with a crisp acidity that gives way to a fresh herbal finish.
â
Pecorino â (Abruzzo) Feuduccio. This fresh, herbaceous white wine opens with grassy aromas and a hint of light wood, followed by bright citrus notes. The palate is balanced with moderate acidity, a touch of earthy minerality, and a subtle sea salt finish.
â
Pinot Grigio â (Friuli) Jermann. Intense aromas of apple and wet stone. Dry and bold for a Pinot Grigio. Pear, honey, and tropical fruits on the palette.
â
Sauvignon Blanc â (Alto Adige) Tramin. Notes of citrus and sugar and tastes of vanilla, peach and citrus on the palette.
â
Vermentino â (Tuscany) Tua Rita. Light, dry, acidic. Citrus, pineapple and crisp green apple are very apparent.
Red
Cabernet â (Lodi) Mettler. Fresh raspberries and black current on the palate. Hints of herbs and pepper.
â
Chianti â (Tuscany) Lamole Di Lamole. Dark ruby in color, medium body. Dry, spicy and oaky.
â
Etna Rosso â (Sicily) Benanti. Notes of blackberries and cherry. Dry and earthy on the palette.
Gaglioppo â (Calabria) Statti. Fruit Forward with Spice. Light-Medium Body, Berry.
â
Merlot/Cabernet â (Tuscany) Tenuta Sette Cieli. Medium body, smooth, and dry. Dark Fruits, vanilla and clove on the palette.
â
Nebbiolo â (Langhe) Paitin. This light-bodied red wine showcases aromas of cedar wood and cherry wood, with a touch of allspice and white pepper adding depth. High acidity and a dry profile provide a crisp structure, making it an elegant, nuanced wine with a savory, slightly spicy finish.
â
Pinot Nero â (Alto Adige) Colterenzio. Ripe cherry and pepper on the nose. Medium body, fruit forward, and dry.
â
Valpolicella â (Veneto) Domini Veneti. Bold, full bodied, and intense aromatics. Vanilla, blackberry, and plum on the palate.
Barbera â (Piedmont) Marcarini. Dry, medium body, smooth. Dark Fruits on the palette with a hint of spice and violet.

Name
Email
Join
North Riverside's Italian Restaurant SInce '68
Welcome to The Village Pub of North Riverside, where friends meet for casual drinks, great food, and we treat everyone like family. We specialize in home-cooked Italian for lunch, dinner, and catering for special events. Our party room is the perfect space for your next occasion, get in touch to reserve your date!
Our Menu
More Than a Great Restaurant
Our restaurant and bar has been serving the community since 1968. Since our humble beginnings, we’ve become a fixture for generations of families in the neighborhood. Our recipes start from scratch and it shows, our customers keep coming back and everyone has their favorite dish on the menu.
Book Your Event
Happy Hour
Tuesday through Friday from 2:30pm to 5pm
Tuesdays
1/2 Priced Wine Bottles
Wednesdays
$5 Off All Burgers, All Day
Sundays
$5 Off All Pasta Dinners
Martini Special
Tues - Thu 5pm-9pm, $10 Martini's in the Bar Area
Game Room
Feeling Lucky? Our Gaming Room is Always Open
Holiday Parties and Special Events
Book Your Parties Now!
The Village Pub has the perfect party room for group and private events. Conveniently located in the heart of North Riverside, our party room can accommodate groups up to 100 with full food and bar service.
Join us for your next special occasion at The Village Pub, we’ll customize everything for you as if it were done at home, minus the cleanup!
View Menu / Book
Lunch
View Menu
Dinner
View Menu
Your Home Away From Home
Village Pub is the perfect getaway to relax after a long day. We have a full bar, friendly patrons, and a even a dedicated gaming room for those who are feeling lucky! We have a family friendly environment everyone can enjoy.
Our Happy Customers
Hear from our guests why we're North Riverside's best!
Christine was an absolute delight. She was upbeat and very friendly. She made our 1st visit very enjoyable. We will be going back and telling our friends about it. The homemade food was to die for. You can tell it was homemade by how fresh it was. Great experience. 🤗

Our Story

We use our old family recipes to deliver a genuine casual Italian dining experience. We don’t compromise on quality. Our food is never frozen and handcrafted using only the finest ingredients.
APPETIZERS
SALADS
PIZZE
PANINI

PASTA

Served with marinara sauce

SALADS
House Salad
Romaine hearts, chick peas, tomatoes, red onions, cucumbers, pepperoncini, parmigiano-reggaino, balsamic vinaigrette

At El Xangarrito, we take pride in serving the finest selection of Mexican dishes inspired by both tradition and innovation. Our talented chefs use fresh ingredients to create flavorful meals that will satisfy even the most discerning palates.
