The Wines of Domaine de la Romanée-Conti
No winery is more famous or produces such legendary wines in Burgundy as Domaine de la Romanée-Conti. The domaine has been co-owned by two families, the de Villaine's and the Roch's/Leroy's, since 1942. Aubert de Villaine, a humble, charming, and highly intelligent vigneron, who is acutely conscious of the history of the domaine and the responsibility he bears towards it, has been the manager and face of the domaine since 1991, when Lalou Bize-Leroy left to focus on her own domaine. Often abbreviated as "DRC", the winery makes some of the most exclusive wines in the world, and 98% of their vineyard holdings are in Grand Cru vineyards, including their two monopoles, "La Tâche" and "Romanée-Conti". DRC's wines, for those lucky enough to have tried them, are regarded as the pinnacle of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay.

Loire Valley Red Wine
Featured Saumur-Champigny
Domaine Le Petit Saint Vincent, "Les Poyeux", 2019
Dominique Joseph, or "Pelo" as he is affectionately called by his friends, is the fourth generation to lead Domaine Le Petit Saint Vincent. Pelo's friendly, direct approach is reflected in his wines and the improvements he has made at the estate, such as converting to organic viticulture and separating out his top parcels for single-vineyard wines. His wines are transparent expressions of the magic that happens when well-farmed Cabernet Franc vines flourish in clay, limestone, tuffeau, or, in the case of this featured wine, sand.

Rhône Valley Red Wine
Featured Côte-Rôtie
Lionel Faury, "Les 3 Brunes", 2021
The Faury family lived very humbly as farmers around the wine-growing region of Côte-Rôtie–they sold fruit, mostly peaches and cherries, and a little wine to the local clientele. It was Phillipe, taking charge in 1976, who had the vision and drive to introduce the world to the family's wine. He expanded slowly, entrenching in his son Lionel this drive for precision and beauty. Lionel took over formally in 2006 and has continued to improve upon the foundation set for him. Things are still done the old-fashioned way: minimal use of new oak, and punchdowns by foot, allowing for gentle extraction and beautiful finesse. The family has plantings dating back to the 1930s, and the "3 Brunes" cuvee comes from select parcels within the famous Côte Brune lieu-dit. Co-fermented with a touch of the white Viognier, this floral, exuberant, sophisticated bottling is a perfect compliment for all savory fare.

Featured Crozes-Hermitage
Alain Graillot, 2022
In France's Rhône Valley, there are few names as revered as Graillot. It was in 1985 that the late, legendary Alain Graillot, who after working with the venerable Jacques Seysses at Domaine Dujac, came back to his home in Crozes-Hermitage to start his own domaine. With each passing year, his devotion to the art of making hauntingly delicious Syrah from his organically farmed, stone-laden vineyards, was rewarded with an ever growing and highly dedicated following around the world. Alain's sons, Maxime and Antoine, have been in charge since 2008, continuing the legacy set forth by their father. All the work is still completely the same as it always was: hand-harvested, organic farming, whole-cluster fermented grapes, and aging the wines primarily in one-to-three year-old barrels.

The Wines of Domaine Jean-Louis Chave
If there were a name synonymous with the hill of Hermitage, it would be that of Jean-Louis Chave. The family began making wine in 1481, passing down wisdom through generations to create some of the most perfectly balanced wines in the world. Traditionalist to the core, the key to this perfect balance of his wines is the remarkable blending skill. This creates wines of great nuance, harmony, depth, and, most importantly, aging potential.

Featured Saint-Joseph
Domaine Monier Perréol, 2020
John Livingstone-Learmonth, one of the most famous Northern Rhône wine experts, has included the wines of Jean-Pierre Monier in his small category of "STGT", or "Soil to Glass Transfer." This means the purity and transparency of the terroir expressed in the wines carefully crafted by Jean-Pierre is reflected so effortlessly in these wines that they deserve to be celebrated along with the best wines of the region. Deciding not to sell his grapes to the local cooperative in 2001, the estate has continued to gain the accolades it so well deserves. Combining resources with his good friend Philippe Perréol, the de-stemmed Syrah provides beautiful aromatic intensity, with finessed texture from the granite-dominant soils found on the steep hillsides of the Saint-Joseph appellation.

Featured Gigondas
Domaine Santa Duc, "Aux Lieux-Dits", 2021
Though it has been making wine since 1874, Domaine Santa Duc has their sights on the future. Coming into the spotlight in 1985 as a pioneer of organic viticulture, Benjamin Gras has now taken the reins and is continuing to innovate with biodynamic practices and a new winery to boot. Sourced from eight different parcels, the "Aux Lieux Dits" cuvée is predominantly made of Grenache from older vines and aged for 18 months in large, old Stockinger oak barrels. Finessed, elegant, with density and power, these wines are some of finest from these "baby Châteauneuf-du-Papes."

Featured Barolo Riserva
Bergadano, Sarmassa, 2018
Founded in 1974, the Bergadano family has always placed an emphasis on quality over quantity at their small two-and-a-half hectare estate. With annual production rarely exceeding 1000 cases, this is a true "insider's" Barolo. The flagship Barolo Riserva comes from the eponymous Barolo commune in the heart of the DOCG. Aromatic and finessed, the 2018 vintage provides a snapshot of the best Nebbiolo offers through the lens of one of the region's most underrated stewards.

Barbaresco
Featured Barbaresco
Barale Fratelli, Serraboella, 2020
The storied Barale family's winemaking history can be traced back to 1870, right when the tiny hamlet of Barolo started causing a stir as a hub for exceptional Nebbiolo in Piedmont. Francesco Barale, great-grandfather of the current owners, was among the pioneers in the production of quality wine from this region. Although based in the commune of Barolo, the family has a sole plot of vines in Barbaresco hailing from the famous Serraboella cru in the village of Nieve. While the vineyards are now proudly certified organic and the winery has adapted to modern practices, the traditional viticultural steps taken have been cemented since Francesco first started bottling under the family's name. The Barale family has never strayed from the classical: extended macerations, no new oak barrels, and showcasing elegance over extraction. Today, Luigi and his daughters, Eleonora and Gloria, carry on the family work in the cellar where, in their own words, "a delicate hand and time are the essential tools to maintain the quality of these wines."

Chianti & Brunello di Montalcino
Featured Brunello di Montalcino
Franco Pacenti, 2018
The Pacenti family moved to the town of Montalcino at the beginning of the last century making a living as sharecroppers. In the 1960s, Rosildo Pacenti, convinced of his homeland's potential to produce world-class Sangiovese, purchased the Canalicchio farm in the northern half of the village and became one of the 25 original founders of the Consorzio del vino Brunello di Montalcino. His son Franco took the reins in 1988, restoring the historic cellar below the old family farm and replanted vines across an additional 10 hectares of land. As Franco's children, the third generation of the winery, join him in the field and cellar, the wines continue to be rooted in tradition with an eye toward the future.

"Super Tuscans"
Featured Bolgheri Red
Tenuta Le Colonne, 2021
Bolgheri is a strong, vigorous territory: a place where international varietals express themselves with great impetus and where the first bottle associated with the "Super Tuscan" movement was produced. Tenuta Le Colonne is located in Donoratico in the southernmost part of the Bolgheri appellation. For their Bolgheri Rosso, Tenuta Le Colonne focuses on Bordeaux varietals, in particular, Merlot, Petit Verdot, and Cabernet Franc. The estate is located in a strategic position, being the winery with the vineyards closest to the Tyrrhenian Sea in the entire denomination. The sea exerts a mitigating action on the climate, increasing light exposure and generating a soft breeze that blows constantly between the rows. Everything here comes from and tells of the sea.

Veneto & Other Italian Red Wine
Featured Veneto Red
Valpolicella Ripasso Classico Superiore, Bussola, "Ca' del Laito", 2019
Tommasso Bussola was a stonemason by trade, and inherited a small plot of his uncle's Valpolicella estate in the early 1980s. This inheritance included a small, old-vine parcel in the heart of the Classico zone. Inquisitive, curious, and experimental, Tommasso thought differently than most of the other growers around him, whose main goal was to sell their fruit to larger cooperatives. He believed that if he worked viticulturally to make his fruit better, the resulting wines would showcase the land and have more purity. And how that made a difference–the late, great Giuseppe Quintarelli was asked about the next "superstar" of the Veneto; his answer: Tommasso Bussola. Having handed down the reins to his sons, Giuseppe and Paolo, the wines continue to be a standard-bearer of excellence in Italy.

Spanish Red Wine
Featured Rioja Reserva
Marqués de Murrieta, 2020
Don Luciano Murrieta made his first wine in Rioja Alta in 1852, drawing on techniques he had learned while studying in Bordeaux. He was one of the first winemakers in Rioja to ship his wines abroad, shining a spotlight on a truly beautiful place in northern Spain. Adhering to "traditional" winemaking techniques, all of Murrieta's wines are aged in American oak barrels, all hand-harvested and sourced from the vineyards outside the Castillo ("castle") de Ygay that was purchased in 1872. Considered part of "Rioja's Aristocracy," winemaker María Vargas continues to create wines of balance, complexity, and harmony that delight and inspire drinkers from all points of view.

Featured Argentinian Malbec
Luca, Paraje Altamira, 2023
The Catena family has been the face of Argentinian wine in the 20th century and beyond. Luca was founded in 1999 by Dr. Laura Catena, a fourth generation vintner, who joined her father's winery in 1995 after graduating magna cum laude from Harvard and earning her M.D. from Stanford. Shortly after, she founded the Catena Institute of Wine with the goal of carrying on her father, Nicolás', vision to put Argentinian Malbec in the same conversation as the best wines in the world.

Featured Portuguese Red
Bairrada, V. Puro, "Alias", 2016
Longtime friends and seasoned winemakers Nuno Mira do Ó and João Soares founded V. Puro based on their shared love for old vines—particularly the native Portuguese grape Baga—which led them to the discovery of an extraordinary 80–120-year-old vineyard in Bairrada, Portugal. The essence of V. Puro lies in expressing the purity of place, grape, and tradition, with a strong emphasis on minimal intervention winemaking. The "Alias" is made from the cooler portions of these ancient vineyards with an aim to express the freshness of Baga when hailing from the Cadoiços Valley, a terroir shaped by the Atlantic influence with soils of clay and limestone. V. Puro has a heartfelt mission: to preserve Portugal's viticultural heritage, to honor the old vines and farmers who came before, and to deliver wines of elegance, depth, and Identity.

Dessert Wines
Featured Vin Santo del Chianti Classico
Villa Calcinaia, Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, 2011
This Tuscan estate has been home to the Capponi family since 1524. Villa Calcinaia is located in the center of the Chianti Classico region, around the town of Greve-in-Chianti, where brothers Sebastiano and Niccolo continue the family tradition to this day. Local grapes Malvasia, Trebbiano, and Colorino are hand-harvested late in the season and are dried in airing chambers until well into March, allowing the grapes to raisinate. They are fermented together and aged in small caratelli barrels, exposed to drastic shifts in temperature for seven or eight years to encourage sugar degradation and concentration of the wine. These supple, delicious wines are some of the finest dessert beverages in the world, a perfect parting sip at the end of a meal.

Featured Half Bottle of Rioja Reserva
R. López de Heredia, "Tondonia", 2010
There are few wineries in Spain, or in the world, whose name conjures the heritage and prestige evoked by R. López de Heredia. Little about this winery has changed since its founding in 1877 by Don Rafael López de Heredia: the winery still occupies the same historic cellars and is owned—and every detail of its operation is handled—by the family who founded it. Most importantly, the family owns every inch of vineyard that supply their wines. For López de Heredia, tradition and conviction are lifelong attitudes.

Large Format
Featured Champagne Magnum
Pierre Péters, "Cuvée Reserve", Blanc de Blancs, Brut, NV
Camille Péters, around 1919, was one of the first growers of the Champagne region to decide to bottle wine under his own name. In 1932, at the ripe age of 12, Pierre Péters, the eldest son of Camille, began to attend his first exhibitions alone and develop sales for his father's brand, and never looked back. He took over operations in 1944, and released his first vintage in 1946 under the "Pierre Péters" brand. The estate, now run by Rodolphe Péters, owns just over 19 hectares of sustainably farmed vineyards, all of which are primarily located in the Côte des Blancs, where the soils are chalky and Chardonnay is king. Their flagship wine, the "Cuvée de Réserve", is made entirely Grand Cru Chardonnay grapes.

Appetizers & Sides
Salads
Sandwiches
Entrées
Kids Menu
Desserts
Drinks
Sauces
Appetizers & Sides
*The Gluten free icon indicates if there is a gluten free option for the menu item.
*
Zesty Sauce
– Our most popular since its introduction in 1981. Tangy tomato based sauce goes great on everything barbeque.
*
Prohibition Sauce
® – Our latest style developed in Kansas City in the summer of 2010. Featuring a unique blend of brown sugar, cracked black pepper and a touch of ghost pepper for a “sweet start and fiery finish®”.
*
Mild Sauce
– From the 1930’s, a mild tomato based sauce featuring cumin, mustard powder and white pepper.
Our Acclaimed Homemade Chili
Choice of shredded cheese, chopped onion or sour cream.
Mini Barbeque Pork Sandwiches
Three mini soft rolls filled with our juicy hand-pulled pork, simmered in our Zesty sauce or Spicy Prohibition sauce.
BBQ Chicken Wings
Tossed with either Zesty sauce or Spicy Prohibition sauce and a side of our homemade bleu cheese buttermilk dressing.
Chicken Tenders
All white meat tenders served with choice of 2 dipping sauces: Prohibition, Zesty, Mild, ranch or honey mustard dressing.
Zesty Baked Beans
Hearty bowl of our unique blend of baked beans, hand-pulled pork, and diced onions, simmered in Zesty sauce.
Pepper-Jack Creamed Spinach
Our tasty creation… with a kick!
Crispy Potato Chips
Fresh fried chips served with homemade bleu cheese buttermilk dressing.
Basket of Onion Rings
Basket of French Fries
Salads
Dinner Caesar Salad
Traditional Caesar with romaine lettuce, parmesan cheese, croutons and anchovy garnish. Chicken Breast, Ahi Tuna or Salmon can be added for an additional price.
1655 Salad
A 6 oz. cut of Ruby Red Ahi tuna on a bed of mixed greens, with pecans, cranberries, crumbled bleu cheese, and Balsamic vinaigrette on the side.
Individual Caesar Salad
Traditional Caesar with romaine lettuce, parmesan cheese, croutons and anchovy garnish.
House Salad
Mixed spring greens, cucumber, tomato and red onion. Served with your choice of dressing: Italian, Creamy Garlic, Balsamic, French, Bleu Cheese, Ranch, or Honey Mustard.
Sandwiches
Served with Coleslaw and slice of dill pickle. Then pick your choice of French Fries, Onion Rings, Baked Potato, Baked Beans, Pepper Jack Creamed Spinach or Steamed Green Beans.
Barbeque Pork Sandwich
Hand-pulled pork on a soft roll. Simmered in our Zesty or Prohibition sauce.
Anchor Burger
One-half pound pure Angus beef on a soft roll with lettuce and tomato. Specify grilled or raw onion.
Cheese Anchor Burger
One-half pound pure Angus beef served on a soft roll with choice of American, Swiss, cheddar or pepperjack cheese served with lettuce and tomato. Specify grilled or raw onion.
Chicken Breast
Grilled chicken breast sandwich on a soft roll with lettuce and tomato. Choice of cheese and barbeque sauce.
Grilled Fish Sandwich
Served on multi-grain bread or a soft roll with lettuce and tomato. Salmon Fillet/Tuna Steak
Zesty “Soy”natra Sandwich
Vegetarian sloppy Joe made with Impossible™ “burger meat”, chopped green peppers, onions and tomatoes, simmered in Zesty or Prohibition sauce.
Grilled Cheese
Choice of American, Swiss, cheddar or pepperjack cheese.
Entrées
Served with  Coleslaw and slice of dill pickle. Then pick your choice of French Fries, Onion Rings, Baked Potato, Baked Beans, Pepper Jack Creamed Spinach or Steamed Green Beans.
Our World Famous Ribs
The world famous Twin Anchors Baby Back Ribs, slow cooked, meaty and tender. Basted with your choice of sauce. Full Slab / Half Slab
Chicken
One half of a slow roasted chicken, finished on the grill with your choice of sauce.
Rib & Chicken Combo
One half rib and one quarter chicken basted with your choice of sauce. Choose white or dark meat chicken.
Fish Fry
A generous portion of golden, crispy battered cod. Served with tartar sauce and lemon.
Our Little Piglet Menu
Served with slice of dill pickle. Then pick your choice of French Fries, Onion Rings, Baked Potato, Baked Beans, Pepper Jack Creamed Spinach or Steamed Green Beans.
Kids Anchor Burger
One-quarter pound pure beef on a soft roll, served with fries and pickle. Add choice of cheese.
Kids Chicken Tenders
All white meat tenders served with fries, pickle and barbeque sauce or dressing on the side.
Small Fry Slab
A kid sized portion of our famous ribs and fries. Ask for either zesty or original mild barbeque sauce.
Kids Grilled Cheese
A kid sized portion with choice of American or Swiss, served with fries and pickle.
Desserts
We hope you saved room!
Plain Cheesecake
A classic slice of plain cheesecake from local Chicago bake shop JR’s Dessert Bakery. May contain nuts.
Chocolate Cake
A luxurious slice of decadent chocolate cake with fudgy frosting from local Evanston bakery Donna’s Cakes. May contain nuts.
Carrot Cake
A traditional slice of carrot cake topped with indulgent cream cheese frosting from local Evanston bakery Donna’s Cakes. May contain nuts.
Hand Dipped Ice Cream Bars
These handmade frozen treats come in a variety of flavors, hand dipped in dark chocolate. Made by local Southside confectioners Brown Sugar Bakery. May contain nuts. Call for flavor availability.
Drinks
We are a Tavern too!
15 beers on draught
Full bar with seasonal, rotating Classic Cocktails
Wine by bottle or glass
Sauces
*
Zesty Sauce
– Our most popular since its introduction 40 years ago. Tangy tomato based sauce goes great on everything barbeque.
*
Prohibition Sauce
® – Our latest style developed in Kansas City in the summer of 2010. Featuring a unique blend of brown sugar, cracked black pepper and a touch of ghost pepper for a “sweet start and fiery finish®”.
*
Mild Sauce
– From the 1930’s, a mild tomato based sauce featuring cumin, mustard powder and white pepper.
Disclaimer language for posted
Gluten-Free
Information
:
Please Know that we practice caution and proper procedure when preparing gluten-free items, however gluten is present in all of our kitchens. All ingredients have been verified as gluten-free by third party consultant, MenuTrinfo®, LLC, but our products can change at any time and products listed might not always be the products served, Twin Anchors Restaurant and Tavern cannot be held responsible for the ingredient substitutions made by out manufacturers, In consuming our gluten-free items, be aware that there still maybe a chance of cross-contact so we cannot guarantee these products for those with celiac disease or food allergy. Guests are advised to consider this information as it relates to their individual dietary needs and requirements.

“One Of Chicago’s Best-Known & Most Respected Full Dining Jazz Venues, Creating Truly
Unique Cultural Experiences For You &Your Guests
.
“
Reservations Required
All Dining & Non-Dining Guests Require Reservations.  All Reservations Are Good For 1 Show Only.  Reserve The Earliest Available Time & Arrive On Time To Be Fully Seated Prior To Show Start.  Room Clears At The End Of Each Show For Next Shows Reservations.
Admission Charged To All
Fri./Sat./Sun./Mon./Tue.
:  $20/Guest –
All Sets
Wed./Thu.
:  $20/Guest –
6pm & 8:15pm
Wed. & Thu.
:  $10/Guest –
10pm Jam Session
Seating Locations
Three Seating Locations Are Available To Choose From When Reserving.  Groups Of 1 Only Reservable In Bar Area.  Under 21 Year Olds Not Permitted Reservations In Bar Area.  Back Corner Is Furthest From Stage With High-Top Bench & Swivel Stool Seating.
Bar Area
Back Corner
Main Seating
Venue Operating Info
All No-Show Reservations That Fail To Cancel Or Reschedule Prior To Show Start Time Will Be Charged Full Price Admission No-Show Fee To Card On File.
Venue Hours
:  5:30pm-12am
Kitchen Hours
:  5:30pm-11:15pm
Live Shows
:  6pm, 8:15pm, 10:30pm –
(Jam Sessions 10pm Start)
Monday/Tuesday
:  Venue Closes 10pm
(No 10:30pm Show)
Seating Information
Groups larger Than 4 Guests May Be Sat At Multiple Tables.  Groups Larger Than 10 Must Contact Us By Email To Secure Reservations.  Unfortunately, We Are Not Able To Move Or Join Tables Together For Larger Groups.
Age Restrictions
Main Seating Area Table Reservations Required For Groups With Under 21 Year Old Guests – Bar Area Not Allowed For Under 21.

CROWD CONSENT & RELEASE
NOTICE OF FILMING & PHOTOGRAPHY
By entering Andy’s Jazz Club you are entering an area where photography, audio and video recording may occur.
Your entry and presence on above mentioned premises constitutes your consent to be photographed, filmed, and/or otherwise recorded and to the release, publication, exhibition, or reproduction of any and all recorded media of your appearance, voice, and name for any purpose whatsoever in perpetuity in connection with Andy’s Jazz Club and its initiatives, including, by way of example only, use on websites, in social media, news and advertising.
By entering, you waive and release any claims you may have related to the use of recorded media of you at the event, including, without limitation, any right to inspect or approve the photo, video or audio recording of you, any claims for invasion of privacy, violation of the right of publicity, defamation, and copyright infringement or for any fees for use of such record media.
You understand that all photography, filming and/or recording will be done in reliance on this consent. If you do not agree to the foregoing, please do not enter.

JOIN OUR TEAM
Welcome
MENU
Fry the Coop Menu: Chicken Sandwiches, Chicken Nuggets, Chicken Tenders, Mac and Cheese, Coleslaw, Chicken and Waffles, Fries and more! Everything is fried in 100% Beef Tallow.
FRY THE COOP MENU
SANDWICHES
Nashville Hot Chicken Sandwich
All white meat natural Chicken breast, double fried in Beef Tallow, topped with homemade Coleslaw, our very own Coop Sauce, on a whole butter toasted Brioche Bun. Choose 4oz Chicken Breast or 7oz Chicken Breast.
Chicago Hot Chicken Sandwich
Double fried Chicken Breast, smothered in Marconi Giardiniera, Coop Sauce, on a whole butter toasted Brioche Bun. Choose 4oz Chicken Breast or 7oz Chicken Breast.
Chicken and Cheese Sandwich
Double fried all white meat Chicken Breast, American Cheese, Sweet and Spicy Bread and Butter Pickles, Coop Sauce, on a whole butter toasted Brioche Bun. Choose 4oz Chicken Breast or 7oz Chicken Breast.
Spicy Butter Fried Chicken Sandwich
All white meat natural Chicken Breast, double fried in Beef Tallow, whipped Honey Butter, on a whole butter toasted Brioche Bun. Choose 4oz Chicken Breast or 7oz Chicken Breast.
Donut Fried Chicken Sandwich
Double fried in Beef Tallow Chicken Breast, with Bread and Butter Sweet and Spicy Pickles, Coop Sauce, on a yeast-raised Double Glazed Donut! Only available in 7oz Chicken Breast.
Veggie Sandwich
Double fried in Beef Tallow seasoned fried, American Cheese, homemade Coleslaw, Bread and Butter Sweet and Spicy Pickles, Coop Sauce, on a Brioche Bun. Note - Beef Tallow Fries optional.
TENDERS
Tender Plate
3 Chicken Tenders, House Fries, homemade Coleslaw, White Bread, Sweet and Spicy Bread and Butter Pickles, with choice of two sauces.
Chicken Tender Flight
6 Jumbo Chicken Tenders with all our heat levels.  Country, Mild, Medium, Hot, Crazy, and Lil Insanity.  Come with all the sauces. Coop Sauce, Ranch, BBQ, Honey Mustard, and Spicy Honey Butter?
CHICKEN NUGGETS
6 Piece Chicken Nuggets
6 count all white meat Chicken Breast, diced in bite size Chicken Nuggets, double fried in Beef Tallow. Choose one sauce - Coop Sauce, Ranch, Honey Mustard or BBQ.
12 Piece Chicken Nuggets
12 count all white meat Chicken Breast, diced in bite size Chicken Nuggets, double fried in Beef Tallow. Choose two sauces - Coop Sauce, Ranch, Honey Mustard or BBQ.
30 Piece Chicken Nuggets
30 count all white meat Chicken Breast, diced in bite size Chicken Nuggets, double fried in Beef Tallow. Choose two sauces - Coop Sauce, Ranch, Honey Mustard or BBQ.
CHICKEN AND WAFFLES
Chicken and Waffles
Two double fried in Beef Tallow Chicken Tenders, homemade Waffle with Smoked Bacon and Pearl Sugar inside the Waffle. Comes with Whipped Spicy Honey Butter and warm Maple Syrup.
MESSY FRIES
”Happiness for Two”
Messy Fries
Mount of double fried Beef Tallow Fries, seasoned with a special Rub, served with diced up Fried Chicken, homemade Coleslaw, Coop Sauce, Sweet and Spicy Bread and Butter Pickles, sprinkled with a garnish of our Mild Seasoning.
SIDES
Beef Tallow House Fries
Double fried russet potatoes in Beef Tallow and a pinch of sea salt. That’s it! Potatoes grown locally here in Illinois.
Seasoned Fries
Double fried Beef Tallow fries, tossed in our Mild Seasoning, with a pinch of sea salt.
Cheese Fries
Double fried Beef Tallow fries, served with pipping hot Cheddar Cheese Sauce.
Messy Fries
Messy Fries for one! Double fried Beef Tallow Fries, seasoned with a special Rub, homemade Coleslaw, Coop Sauce, Sweet and Spicy Bread and Butter Pickles, sprinkled with a garnish of our Mild Seasoning.  Add chicken for $1.50
Mac and Cheese
Seasoned White Cheddar Maci & Cheese
Potato Salad
All American-style potato salad made with a combination of fresh-cooked potatoes, diced eggs, garden-fresh celery, onions, bits of red peppers and sweet relish in a seasoned house-made dressing.
Coleslaw
Homemade Coleslaw made with shredded green cabbage, carrots and red cabbage tossed in a house made coleslaw dressing.
Side of Pickles
Sweet and spicy Bread and Butter pickles. They are zesty to the max.
Cheese Sauce
Aged Cheddar Cheese Sauce made with real cheddar cheese delivering rich cheddar flavor.

17.95

17.95

17.95

The
Original Lettuce Entertain You Creation
R.J. Grunts is the original Lettuce Entertain You creation, located in the heart of Lincoln Park just steps from the zoo. We cater to the neurotic compensation of eating with our all-American menu that includes the tastiest burgers in town and hand-spun shakes and malts. That funky lifestyle of the ’70s is still exuded in our style, décor and music.

About the Business
Business owner information
B R.
Business Owner
Prost!, (2566 N. Lincoln Ave.) located in the bustling Lincoln Park neighborhood, has the feel of a classic German restaurant and beer hall. The wide selection of beer on tap imported straight from Deutschland and traditional German cuisine highlight the thriving festive German culture.

Prost! maintains authentic detail, complete with long rows of imported rustic tables and benches that line the outer walls as well as a cobblestone pathway leading to their massive draft beer bar. As you stroll through the crowd, be sure to give a nod and hoist your heavy liter stein filled with any one of their 24 draft beers, all specially imported straight from Deutschland. 

In addition, Prost! has all of the characteristics that make it the perfect spot for watching sports. Not only do they have an ideal Game Day Menu, but also over 20 Progressive Scan Flat Screen TVs that broadcast your games of the day in High Definition -the final touch to the past meets present atmosphere you'll find at Prost!
…

We now take credit cards!
Let the good folks at Moody's Pub rustle up the BEST BURGERS IN CHICAGO , according to the Tribune, Sun-Times, Chicago Magazine and Citysearch.com.
Enjoy great food and a bargain in Moody's cozy dining room. It has the feel of a ski lodge and features two ROARING FIREPLACES, beamed ceiling with overhead fans, brick and stucco walls, stained glass and a bowl of COMPLIMENTARY PEANUTS on every candlelit table. Chicago Magazine has named Moody's one of the most romantic spots in the city.
Moody's is convenient to public transportation. The number 36 Broadway bus stops right in front and the Thorndale el stop on the red line is a two minute walk.
Fight the winter blahs with charcoal broiled food, reasonable prices and a great atmosphere at Moody's Pub.

Functional
These cookies allow the Controller’s web application to remember choices you make while browsing and/or using the application (such as your user name, language or the region you are in) and provide enhanced, more personal features.
These cookies can also be used to remember changes you have made to text size, language and other parts of web pages that you can customize.
The information these cookies collect will not personally identify you, and they cannot track your browsing activity on non Controller’s websites.
For reliable review of your order status, on-screen on the application, in real-time, and also for easy reordering, your data may be saved on your device, serving a cookie locally.

Alfarsi Restaurant – Chicago’s Authentic Persian Restaurant with Mediterran
Savor bold flavors and warm hospitality in every dish.
Order Online and Receive 10% Off!
Discover Alfarsi Restaurant
A Taste of Tradition
At Alfarsi Restaurant, we pride ourselves on our rich Mediterranean and Persian heritage. Our menu features traditional dishes crafted with care, using only the freshest ingredients to ensure an authentic culinary experience.
L Mediterranean Delights: A Visual Feast for the Senses

Entrees
All entrees are served with your choice of white rice, dill rice, or fries. For an additional $4.95, you may substitute the rice option with cranberry polo or sautéed vegetables. All signature kebabs are served with grilled onion and tomato.

Beverages
Earl Grey Tea
3

Chamomile Tea

Turkish Coffee
4
Iced Tea Lemon
5
White Wine
Noble House Riesling
Germany | Glass | Bottle
An appealing bouquet of peach and apple aroma. A very balanced and harmonious wine with delicate aromas and minerality.
11 | 37
Tortoise Creek Chardonnay
California | Glass | Bottle
Boasts bright, fresh aromas and flavors of citrus, pear, apple and white flowers. Its creamy texture is supported by fresh acidity and along, clean finish.
12 | 39
Pratsch Organic Gruner Veltliner
Austria | Glass | Bottle
Fruit forward with a touch of apple, peach, and apricot with a slight spice. Fresh and tangy, fine spices; white pepper and round body.
12 | 38
Sea Pearl Sauvignon Blanc
Marlborough | Glass | Bottle
Light-bodied, dry, and crisp, this wine is full of the typical Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc flavors of gooseberry and passion fruit. Best enjoyed with seafood, pasta, white meats, and summer salads.
14 | 41
Pinot Grigio delle Venezie
Italy | Glass | Bottle
A fresh, floral nose with notes of acacia flowers. On the palate, it is dry and well-balanced with lively fruit flavors.
12 | 39
Sparkling Rosé
Bricco Riella Moscat D 'Asti
Italy | Glass | Bottle
Moscato D'Asti is a semi-sweet, lightly sparkling, low-alcohol wine from Piedmont, in north-western Italy. The classic Moscato D'Asti wine is characterized by elegant floral aromas and notes of peach, apricot, and fresh grape juice.
11 | 39
Milbrandt Rosé
Columbia Valley | Glass | Bottle
Delicately, faint pink Rosé! Fresh, with hints of melon, fresh berries. Beautifully perfumed. Honeysuckle, strawberry, cherry, and resounding minerality that leads to an enchanting finish.
11 | 34
Akakies Sparkling Rose
Northwestern Greece | Glass | Bottle
An intense mousse and a bright cherry color, pronounced aromas of ripe strawberry and cherry, and an elegant acidity adding freshness while pairing harmoniously with the discrete presence of sugars create a wine that is at the same time dynamic and balanced.
11 | 38
Tiamo Prosecco
Italy | Glass | Small Bottle
Large Bottle The wine offers fresh and rich fruity aromas of apple and pear with a hint of citrus fruit that fades into the floral bouquet.
11 | 38
Red Wine
Bouchard Aîné and Pinot Noir
Italy | Glass | Bottle
France | Bottle | Glass Fine and subtle nose with pleasant aromas of small black fruits. A supple and round mouth with soft tannins and a nice freshness.
12 | 39
Farmhouse Red
California | Glass | Bottle
Intense bouquet of dark cherry, barnyard, and dark chocolate. It is medium bodied, juicy, dry, and smooth. The extracted flavors of cherry, plum, cranberry, and black pepper blend nicely.
12 | 39
Fortant Cabernet Sauvignon
France | Glass | Bottle
Boasting relatively young and rather fertile soils, this terroir, with the help of modern viticulturist and wine-making techniques, is well-suited to bringing out all of the aromas and flavors of each grape variety.
12 | 38
Santa Julia Malbec
Argentina | Glass | Bottle
A pretty, smooth, and approachable Malbec with partial and subtle oak aging , leaving the emphasis on the spice, damson, and black cherry flavors.
12 | 38
Delicioso Tempranillo
Spain | Glass | Bottle
Juicy and jammy, yet well-structured and balanced. Bright red aromas of ripe raspberry, plum, and licorice. Deep, lively, and vibrant flavors on the palate. Velvety tasting with a solid finish.
14 | 41
Old Vine Zinfandel
California | Glass | Bottle
This wine gets its personality from the 50 to 100-year-old vines where the grapes are grown from. Flavors of sweet cherries, blackberries, and earthy spice. Jammy and robust through the long finish.
14 | 41
Alexander Valley Vineyards Merlot
California | Glass | Bottle
Spicy aromas of dark fruits, cassis, cherry, plum, vanilla, oak, and slight chocolate in the glass
14 | 41
Decero Malbec
Add Argentina | Glass | Bottle
A medium-bodied, very well-balanced wine with fresh acidity, it shows supple and elegant tannins that benefit from 14 months of maturation in French oak barrels.
14 | 41
Marques De Riscal Rioja Reserva
Spain | Glass | Bottle
Intriguing ruby red, captivating dark fruit flavors and hints of toasted oak, black cherry notes and earthy complexity during its slow finish
14 | 54

Sultan’s Market Menu
Middle Eastern Food with Vegan, & Healthy options for Lunch & Dinner.
Sultan’s Market offers a wide variety of
Vegan, Vegetarian, and Gluten Free options,
all made from scratch daily with fresh ingredients and authentic spices. And don’t worry, we didn’t forget the
Meat Lovers,
hearty options for everyone, served with care.

$4

$4

$4

$4

The
Salad Bar
at Sultan’s Market is all about freshness, loaded daily with vibrant veggies, house-made toppings, and bold flavors. Add your choice of Lamb Shawarma, Chicken Shawarma, or Kefta Kabob, or keep it vegan with our signature Falafel. Build it your way, fresh every time.

$7

$9.50

hummus, tabuli salad, pita bread and a choice of rice (curry rice or lentils)

Menu - Olive Mountain Grill

About
Menu

Menu
Menu
admin
2025-09-18T14:49:35-05:00
Appetizers
Start your meal with our fresh, flavorful appetizers made from traditional recipes and the finest ingredients. From creamy hummus to crispy falafel, each bite is a perfect taste of the Mediterranean.
Hummus
Creamy chickpea dip
Baba Ghanouj
Smoky eggplant spread
Falafel
Crispy chickpea fritters
Spinach Pie
Flaky spinach pastry
Meat Pie
Savory meat pastry
Grilled Mushrooms
Char-grilled mushrooms
Soups & Salads
Fresh, crisp, and full of flavor, our salads and soups are made with high-quality ingredients and traditional Mediterranean recipes. From hearty lentil soup to vibrant salads, each dish is a refreshing start to your meal.
Lentil Soup
Warm, spiced lentil broth
Grilled Chicken Salad
Tender chicken with fresh greens
Mediterranean Salad
Crisp lettuce, tomatoes, and onions
Fattoush Salad
Fresh vegetables with toasted bread
Tabouleh Salad
Parsley, tomatoes, and cracked wheat
Jerusalem Salad
Tomatoes, cucumbers, and tahini
Greek Salad
Fresh greens topped with Feta cheese
Yogurt Cucumber Salad
Cool cucumbers in garlicky yogurt
Falafel Salad
Mediterranean greens with crispy falafel
Sandwiches
Our sandwiches are packed with authentic Mediterranean flavors and fresh ingredients, perfect for a quick lunch or a satisfying meal on the go. From shawarma to falafel, each sandwich is crafted to deliver bold, traditional taste.
Beef Shawarma Sandwich
Thinly sliced marinated beef and lamb
Chicken Shawarma Sandwich
Juicy marinated chicken with garlic sauce
Beef Shish Kabab Sandwich
Tender beef cubes with fresh veggies
Kifta Kabab Sandwich
Spiced ground beef and lamb skewers
Chicken Breast Kabab Sandwich
Grilled chicken with fresh toppings
Falafel Sandwich
Crispy chickpea falafel with Jerusalem salad
Lamb, Chicken & Fish
Our lamb, chicken, and fish entrees feature expertly grilled proteins paired with fresh vegetables and authentic Mediterranean flavors. Each dish is crafted to highlight traditional spices and cooking techniques for a truly memorable meal.
Lamb Chops
Savory grilled lamb with hummus
Chicken Shawarma
Marinated, slow-roasted sliced chicken
Chicken Breast Kabab
Tender char-grilled chicken breasts
Salmon Kabab
Grilled marinated salmon with vegetables
Grilled Shrimps
Char-grilled shrimp served with veggies
Beef
Our beef entrees are crafted with premium cuts, marinated with traditional spices, and grilled to perfection. Each dish delivers authentic Middle Eastern flavor in every bite.
Beef Shawarma
Thinly sliced marinated beef and lamb
Beef Shish Kabab
Tender grilled beef cubes
Kifta Kabab
Spiced ground beef and lamb skewers
Vegetarian Platters
Our vegetarian platters are packed with fresh, flavorful, and wholesome Mediterranean favorites. Perfect for sharing or enjoying on your own, each dish highlights classic Middle Eastern recipes.
Vegetarian Combo
Falafel, hummus, baba ghanouj, grape leaves & salad
Falafel Platter
Crispy falafel with Jerusalem salad
Desserts
End your meal on a sweet note with our delicious Mediterranean desserts. From flaky, nutty pastries to rich cheesecakes, there’s a treat for every craving.
Baklawa
Flaky pastry with nuts and honey
Sliced Cheesecake
Creamy, classic cheesecake
Sliced Chocolate Cake
Rich and decadent chocolate dessert

raw_text:
Menu – Taste of Lebanon
Skip to content (Press Enter)
Taste of Lebanon
Home
Services
Menu
Story
Reservation
Home

Story

Home
>
Menu
Menu
Let’s talk about the hummus. It’s not just a dip; it’s a creamy cloud of joy that dances on your palate. Smooth and rich, it pairs perfectly with fluffy pita bread. And oh, the tabbouleh! This refreshing salad is a burst of sunshine, with its zesty lemon and crisp parsley. It’s the kind of dish that makes you feel good from the inside out, kind of like a sunny day after a week of rain.
And don’t even get me started on the grilled kebabs! Imagine succulent chunks of marinated meat, charred to perfection, giving you that satisfying crunch on the outside and juicy tenderness within—a metaphorical high-five for your mouth. You can even enjoy vegetarian options like stuffed grape leaves, which are as satisfying as any hearty meal, filled with rice, herbs, and spices.
Dessert? Oh boy, save some room for baklava. Each bite is a sweet, flaky masterpiece, drizzled with honey and sprinkled with nuts. It’s as if you’re experiencing a little piece of heaven. So, whether you’re a lifelong fan of Lebanese cuisine or new to these flavors, the Taste of Lebanon menu promises an unforgettable dining experience that keeps you coming back for more. It’s truly a celebration on a plate!
Savoring the Flavors of Lebanon: A Culinary Journey Through the Taste of Lebanon Menu
From the first bite of hummus, you’re greeted with a creamy texture that’s like a velvet glove hugging your taste buds. It’s surprisingly addictive! Paired with warm, fluffy pita bread, it’s an invitation to dig in further. And don’t even get me started on tabbouleh! This herbaceous salad bursts with freshness, almost like a garden party in your mouth. Each bite is an explosion of bright flavors, with parsley that dances alongside those juicy tomatoes and a zing of lemon that leaves you wanting more.
Then, we have the main stars of the menu: the aromatic kebabs and tangy shawarma. Picture tender pieces of marinated meat, grilled to perfection. It’s like taking a trip to Lebanon without leaving your seat! The spices are a symphony, playing harmoniously together, ensuring every dish is a celebration on your palate. And for the daring, you must try the kibbeh – it’s like the Lebanese version of a meatball, but with a twist that’ll have you questioning every meatball you’ve ever eaten!
Unraveling the Secrets: What Makes the Taste of Lebanon Menu a Must-Try Experience
First off, let’s talk about the ingredients. The Taste of Lebanon menu is like a treasure chest filled with vibrant spices, fresh herbs, and locally sourced produce. Each dish tells a story, a nod to generations of Lebanese tradition where home-cooked meals are a point of pride. Imagine biting into a warm, fluffy pita, the aroma of za’atar rising like a cherished memory. Isn’t it incredible how food can transport you?
And it doesn’t stop there. The menu is a symphony of flavors—think savory grilled meats, creamy hummus, and tabbouleh that’s as fresh as a sun-kissed garden. Every dish is crafted with love and attention, like a masterpiece waiting to be savored. Have you ever wondered how a simple dish can ignite your senses? That’s the magic of Lebanese cuisine!
What truly makes the Taste of Lebanon a must-try experience is the communal aspect of the meal. Picture this: a table filled with vibrant dishes, laughter rising with each bite. It’s an invitation to gather, share, and enjoy—the very essence of the Lebanese culture. There’s something heartwarming about passing around mezze, isn’t there?
So, if your taste buds are ready for an adventure that’s rich in flavor and tradition, the Taste of Lebanon menu might just be the secret treasure you’ve been searching for. Why wait? Dive into this unforgettable culinary experience!
From Meze to Mains: Exploring the Diverse Delights of the Taste of Lebanon Menu
Imagine starting your meal with a plate of warm, fluffy pita bread accompanied by a spread of hummus that’s smoother than a jazz melody. It’s like a friendly hug for your taste buds. And let’s not forget about tabbouleh, that refreshing parsley salad that dances with lemony zest. It’s a wonderful way to kick off your dining experience, teasing your palate and setting the stage for what’s to come.
As we venture deeper into the menu, the mains await like a grand finale in a symphony. Picture tender kebabs marinated in spices, sizzling and bursting with flavor. Each skewer is a revelation, blending savory and spicy in a way that leaves you craving more. Oh, and the shawarma? It’s like a warm embrace wrapped in a delightful shawarma sauce that makes your heart skip a beat.
But wait, there’s more! The vegetarian options are no mere afterthought; dishes like mujaddara—lentils and rice topped with caramelized onions—offer a comforting depth that rivals any meat dish. It’s a warm bowl of home, perfect for those cozy nights or when you simply want to indulge without guilt.
So, whether you’re nibbling on those delicious meze or diving straight into the hearty mains, the Taste of Lebanon menu is all about exploration and delight. The fusion of flavors and textures invites you to step outside of the ordinary and savor every moment. Isn’t it time for you to embark on this delectable adventure?
A Feast for the Senses: Highlights of the Taste of Lebanon Menu You Can’t Miss
Let’s talk about the meze – those delightful small plates that can turn a simple meal into a grand feast. Ever tried tabbouleh? This refreshing salad bursts with crisp parsley, juicy tomatoes, and a hint of lemon that can brighten up any dull day. And don’t overlook the kibbeh! This Lebanese delicacy, made from spiced ground meat and bulgur, is like a flavorful hug for your taste buds.
Feeling adventurous? The grilled meats are where flavor takes center stage. Picture succulent skewers of shawarma, marinated to perfection and chargrilled until they’re a tantalizing golden brown. One bite, and you’ll swear you’ve been transported to the bustling streets of Beirut, the scent of spices swirling around you.
And then there’s the falafel – crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, these little green balls are the perfect companions for the tahini sauce that drips like liquid gold. They’re not just a vegetarian option; they’re a celebration of flavor that even meat lovers can’t resist.

Learn More
About Nia Restaurant
Welcome to Nia Restaurant and Wine Bar
Best Mediterranean Restaurant on Randolph Street in West Loop, Chicago
Welcome to Nia Restaurant and Wine Bar, a gem in the heart of West Loop, Chicago, conveniently located on Randolph Street’s vibrant dining scene. Renowned as one of the best Mediterranean restaurants in Chicago, we invite you to embark on a delightful culinary journey that transports you to the Mediterranean. From the moment you step through our doors, you’ll experience unparalleled warmth and hospitality.
more about us
Our Hours
Book a Reservation at Nia Restaurant and Wine Bar Today
Monday – Sunday: Closed
Tuesday – Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM
Friday – Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM
Happenings
Private Parties
Nia is delighted to offer several options for private events and private dining. The intimate main dining room radiates the golden colors of the sunny Mediterranean in its iridescent tiles, stained glass sconces and dabbled walls.
Learn More
Private Dining
Private Dining For private dining, whether you wish to entertain a group of ten or impress your friends and family Nia and her events manager will be there to help you every step of the way.
Learn More
Corporate Events
Whether you wish to entertain a group of 10 in our main dining room or impress 80 seated guests with your next corporate event hosted in Nia’s private dining room.
Learn More
Bridal Showers
Whether those bells are for you, a good friend, or a relative, one of the fun lead-up events to a wedding is the bridal shower.
Learn More
Rehearsal Dinners
As the star of the wedding weekend, you can re-direct the spotlight for one evening by dedicating the rehearsal dinner to the man in your life in the intimate setting at Nia.
Learn More
Safety Guidelines
At Nia we are following and in accordance local and national guidelines to keep our staff and customers safe during the COVID Pandemic.
Private Event
Take a Trip to the Mediterranean at Nia
Restaurant and Wine Bar
It seemed impossible. Nia Restaurant and Wine Bar broke that mold, and today, it stands tall as one of the most renowned locations in the world for authentic Mediterranean food and Roman-style pizza.
As soon as you walk through our doors, you’ll be greeted by an atmosphere of unmatched warmth and hospitality. Our talented chef takes great care in crafting a delectable menu that reflects a true passion for Mediterranean cuisine. Whether you’re in the mood for succulent Branzino or Roman style pizza in Gold Coast, IL, our food will delight your palate. Nia truly shines as one of the top dining spots in the West Loop, beautifully blending the delicate flavors of seafood with the comforting appeal of pizza.
To enhance your experience, our knowledgeable sommeliers are ready to guide you through our extensive wine list, expertly pairing the finest Mediterranean dishes with the perfect glass of vino. Whether you’re enjoying a crisp white with your seafood or a robust red alongside your pizza, our selection is sure to impress. Our steadfast commitment to excellence shines through in every sip, ensuring that each glass of wine elevates your meal to new heights.

Mediterranean Restaurant in Hcicago for Bruce Wu
★★★★★
Mediterranean Restaurant in Hcicago
Jan 1, 1970
I tried the Chef’s Tasting menu. It was a very filling meal. Would definitely come here hungry if you want to be able to finish the meal.
First Course – Mushroom Tapenade – it was a perfect blend mushroom consistency
Second Course – Nia Salad – Great Mix of sweet candied Walnuts and savory Goat Cheese
Third
Course – Cauliflower – Very tasty and good portion size. Slightly spicy.
Fourth Course – French Onion Soup – Very good size soup. Not too salty.
Fifth Course -Gambas Al Ajillo – Really tasty. Shrimp still has tail attached
Sixth Course – Charred Skirt Steak – Decent portion size to share. Meat was very tender and chewy. Perfect Consistency. Some people might prefer medium rare.
Seventh Course – Au Gratin Potatoes – Great Tasting. Went really well with the Skirt Steak
Eighth Course – Burnt Basque Cheesecake – This might be the best Cheesecake I’ve very had. Not too sweet and very soft and fluffy.

DETAILS & RESERVATIONS
Hours
Monday - Friday: 11am - 10pm
Saturday: 10:30am - 10pm
Sunday:  10:30am - 9pm
Happy Hour: Sun - Fri, 3pm - 6pm
AVLI ON THE PARK
Avli on The Park is a neighborhood gem tucked away downtown Chicago in Lakeshore East.
The remarkable closeness to The Loop, shopping, and entertainment, along with easy access to popular Maggie Daley Park, makes Avli in Lakeshore East a perfect destination for a celebratory night out, group brunch, or an easy family neighborhood lunch or dinner.
We are now offering complimentary valet for dinner service!
Stop-in for
Happy Hour
—Sunday through Friday, from 3pm-6pm—for discounted cocktails and bites, or try join us for weekday lunch and enjoy our
three-course $30 lunch special menu
.
Host an Event
Centrally located in downtown Chicago, Avli on The Park is complete with a seasonal rooftop, private banquet room, and multiple semi-private event spaces. The venue features an attached garage for convenient and accessible guest parking on the day of your event.
VIEW SPACES & INQUIRE
Order
Avli Catering
From backyard parties to large scale corporate events, weddings, graduations, and more—Avli catering is the perfect addition to your next event.

OUR STORY
Πλατεία is the Greek word for town square. In traditional villages, plateias are the central places for feasts, celebrations, and events. Here at Plateia, we want our guests to come together and experience the hospitality of the Greek culture with the taste of the Mediterranean. Along with the energy of a bustling bar, our restaurant brings the Mediterranean cuisine’s sophistication and charisma to Glenview’s dining scene.
EVENTS AT PLATEIA
FOR ANY OCCASION
Plan your next gathering with us. Flexible layouts, full-service catering, and an attentive team that makes every detail look just right.

raw_text:
Serbian Food | Mt Prospect | Balkan Taste
top of page
2354 S. Elmhurst Rd
Mt Prospect, IL 60056
Directions
​
Call Us: 224-607-0507
BALKAN TASTE
.
authentic serbian cuisine
.
ORDER ONLINE
HOME
FAST BITES
DAILY DISHES
SERBIAN GRILL
DRINKS
ABOUT US & MEDIA
MENU
FRESH, DELICIUS, HOME - MADE MEALS
. Best of Serbian Cuisine .
What do we serve daily?
Fast Bites
Appetizers! In Serbian cuisine they include Antipasto with prosciutto, salami and and a range of cheeses such as kackavall and feta, spreads like Ajvar (pepper and eggplant spread) and kajmak (aged sweet cream) and delicious and hearty pastry such as gibanica, burek and other filo dough pita pastries with a variety of meat, cheese and vegetables such as spinach and potato.
1
​
Food & Drinks
Serbian Antipasto
Proscuitto, salame, Feta, Kackavall, Ajvar, Kajmak
press to zoom
gibanica
Serbian Filo Pastry with Cheese
press to zoom
lepinja with kajmak and egg
Home made bread (lepinja) with kajmak and egg
press to zoom
Serbian everyday cuisine bursts with healthy ingredients and flavor! you can call it fresh, well seasoned with herbs and spices and is usually a combination of meat with a main vegetable cooked or baked together so that the flavors blend. It is usually seasoned with sea salt, black pepper and Paprika and a blend of herbs. Onion, garlic and carrots add flavor to most dishes. It is said that Serbian cuisine combines the flavors of Mediterranean, Central European and Middle Eastern flavors. Here is an good article on typical Serbian foods and dishes, of which we serve all!
https://www.lonelyplanet.com/serbia/travel-tips-and-articles/europes-foodie-secret-serbian-cuisine/40625c8c-8a11-5710-a052-1479d276618b
​
Here's another good reading on typical Serbian dishes
http://www.serbia.com/10-serbian-recipes-everybody-know/
​
,
Prebranac sa dimljenim kobasicama
Re-fried Beans with Smoked Sausages
press to zoom
Losos sa grilovanim povrcem
Salmon with Grilled Vegetables
press to zoom
Dimljena piletina, pire i sataras
Smoked chicken with Mashed potatoes and Sataras
press to zoom
Govedji gulas i pire
Beef stew with Mashed potatoes
press to zoom
Punjena paprika i pire
Stuffed bell peppers with Mashed potatoes
press to zoom
Sarma
- Dolmades
press to zoom
Daily Dishes
2
Serbian Grill
3
The taste of typical Serbian Grill item, such as Cevapcici (or Cevapi) or Pjeskavica can be best described as well seasoned, yet mild, and though similar in form with Greek and Middle Eastern grill, it is not as not overwhelming with taste of herbs. In Serbia, these favorites are served as  street food in a bun and often in fine dining restaurants as a plate with a selection of mixed meats and sides. There's plenty of articles talking about Cevapi and Pljeskavica, but to give you an idea of what goes inside, here's a recipe by famous chef Jamie Oliver:
http://www.serbia.com/jamie-oliver-makes-cevapi-ajvar/
Cevapi na kajmaku
Ground Beef links grilled with onion and kaymak
press to zoom
Punjena pljeskavica
Serbian style Burger, stuffed with Asiago cheese and Prosciutto
press to zoom
Raznjici i pomfrit
Pork Skewers and French fries
press to zoom
Dimljene kobasice sa graskom
Smoked sausages with Green peas and Mashed potatoes
press to zoom
Dimljena svinjska krmenadla
Smoked Pork Chop served with Mashed Potatoes and Sauerkraut
press to zoom
Mesano meso
Mixed meat plate
press to zoom
Talking about fine dining, our desert selection is on par with the best Chicago restaurants. On a high note, if this is not enough, it includes a unique mix of offerings - from European style torts made with fine ingredients such as chocolate, vanilla and nuts, small deserts such as cream puffs, chocolate and vanilla cakes, coconut puffs, crapes as well as Serbian filo ppastry made with nuts and fruits, similar to baklava and other Greek and Middle-Eastern deserts. We make baklava, too!
​
​
Drinks! This is another area where we can say we can compare to top Chicago restaurants, Serbian way! We serve top shelf Serbian liquor - rakija (Serbian double distilled brandy), wine and beer. Rakija comes in a number of flavors depending if it's made from plum, apple, quince, apricot or grape. We also offer traditional liquor served in your typical Chicago-land restaurant.

About Us / Media
This is our third year serving unique Serbian flavor to Chicago-land! We serve a combination of foods, from everyday dishes to fine dining Serbian dinner offerings, with fine deserts and top shelf Serbian drinks. At Balkantaste you will enjoy authentic taste of Serbia in a casual dining atmosphere.
We do catering and special events! We can produce food for your party or serve a party of up to sixty people at our place, including hosting music entertainment for your guests.
A special perk! if you come in for a meal, you will most likely get to meet our chef. A graduate of Belgrade University, with a degree in Sports , a former basketball player and a graduate of Le Cordon Blue Culinary Arts Program, this good sport spends most of the day creating our menu items. He also owns and operates Balkantaste and in spare time enjoys extreme sports in addition to creating magic the kitchen with his unique energy.
Meet Bojan Bojanovic who brings the daily delights to your table!
​
​

Welcome to Zam Zam Middle Eastern Grill â Authentic Flavors in the Heart of Chicago
At Zam Zam Grill, we bring you a true taste of the Middle East with fresh, flavorful dishes made from locally sourced ingredients and traditional spices. Located in Lakeview, Chicago, our halal kitchen is run by a passionate team dedicated to crafting meals that are both comforting and bold. From sizzling shawarma to house-made hummus and fluffy laffa bread, every dish is made with care to celebrate the joy of good food and good company. Join us and experience authentic Middle Eastern cuisineâmade to be shared.
Order Now
Only the Freshest Ingredients â Always Halal, Always Delicious
At Zam Zam Grill, we use only the freshest, high-quality ingredients to bring you the best in authentic Middle Eastern cuisine. From crisp vegetables to premium halal meats, every dish is crafted with care to deliver rich flavor and wholesome nutrition. Weâre passionate about quality, and it shows in every shawarma wrap, kabob plate, and spoonful of our house-made hummus. Taste the difference real ingredients makeâright here in Lakeview, Chicago.
Order Now
Pita Sandwiches Made with Passion and Fresh Ingredients
At Zam Zam Grill, every pita sandwich is handcrafted with careâusing fresh, high-quality halal ingredients and traditional Middle Eastern flavors. Whether youâre craving chicken shawarma, beef gyro, or falafel, each bite is packed with bold spices and authentic taste. Itâs our love for great food and community that keeps our customers coming back. Proudly serving Lakeview, Chicago with flavorful food that feels like home.
Order Now
Try Our Signature Laffa Bread â Fresh, Soft & Straight from the Grill
Our laffa bread is a fluffy, hand-stretched flatbread thatâs a staple of Middle Eastern cuisineâserved fresh off the grill and made in-house daily. Whether wrapped around our juicy shawarma or served alongside hummus and dips, our laffas bring authentic flavor and comfort to every meal. Taste the difference real, traditional bread makesâright here in Lakeview, Chicago.
Order Now
Order Online Directly from Zam Zam Grill
Skip the third-party fees and get your food fasterâwhen you order straight from our website, you save money, enjoy priority service, and earn rewards toward free meals. Itâs the easiest way to enjoy fresh, halal Middle Eastern food in Lakeview, Chicagoâwhile supporting your favorite local restaurant.
Order Now
Join the Zam Zam Grill Rewards Program
Love shawarma, falafel, and fresh Middle Eastern food? Earn points every time you order online or in-store at Zam Zam Middle Eastern Grill in Lakeview, Chicago. Our rewards program gives you access to exclusive deals, free menu items, and updates on new dishes and promotions. Itâs our way of saying thanks for supporting local.
Join Now
What our guests are saying
Check out our most recent reviews!
Usha Gupta
This is my favorite place to order from. The food is SO fresh, flavors outstanding, great variety and a kind and accommodating staff. When the staff says the food is âmade with loveâ it is obvious. I highly recommend this spot and so far have tried most of their appetizers and salads, most of their meats, and their
...
vegetarian options and have always loved each dish. Highly recommend!!

And yes, I may be addicted as I order 1-2 times per week for lunchâ¦
Read More
Oscar Garcia
If youâre stumbling around after a wild night out or just happen to be in the wrigley neighborhood craving some top-tier habibi cuisine, this place delivers. The moment you walk in, youâre greeted by the queen of the grill (she calls herself Wendy but weâll go Queen or whateva)â Sheâll automatically with you with shot
...
of MalÃ¶rt in one hand, smile in the other, and what Iâm 95% sure is a Mexican-imported BBL that deserves its own zip code
Read More
V
Zam zam is a hidden gem ! I absolutely recommend it .. after a cubs game best place to go for a bite ! The chicken sharwma bowl is amazing !! The costumer service is great also !
Kaithlee S
I love it here! The environment is super great, costumer service is great, and the food is amazing. I love the chicken shawarma!!

Fantasy & sci-fi
inspired artwork adorn the walls creating a cozy, unique space.
Twenty sided dice
roll on the backroom gaming tables next to
pinball machines,
both new & vintage.  A
movie projected on brick
is the only screen to be found other than classic
Nintendo, Sega
and
xBox
played on
vintage TVs
.  Often a game of
Giant Uno
will break out.
Started as the prep kitchen for the award winning
DönerMen food truck,
DMen’s scratch kitchen still uses the same recipes to make their
Chicago Style Döner Kebabs
and legendary
CurryWurst
.  The menu has expanded from the food truck days to include
Malört Ice Cream
and
Giant Pretzels
, as well as
house made vegan seitan
,
shiitake gravy
and
fermented hot sauce
.
Annual events like
Malört Days
,
Pickle Fest
,
Krampus Parade
&
Mead Fest
have become beloved traditions
.
You won’t find any sports ball here, we make our own fun.
Phone
(773) 961-8757
Location
2849 W Belmont
in East Avondale
Chicago, IL 60618

Pita Inn Glenview, IL
Fill 1
Download Menu
Fill 1
Download Menu
Opened in 2003, Pita Inn quickly put itself on the map.
Glenview, located right between our Skokie and Wheeling Pita Inn locations, is known as the place where customers turn to find out the secret of our success from our manager, who puts it simply: “We make our food with love.” This location has become a favorite gathering spot for loyal patrons who appreciate our warm hospitality, authentic flavors, and commitment to quality. Whether you’re a first-time visitor or a longtime fan, you’ll experience the same passion and dedication in every dish we serve.
With ample seating and a newly expanded parking lot, our customers can enjoy their meals in our dining room or outdoors during the summer months, surrounded by a welcoming atmosphere. Whether you’re grabbing a quick bite or settling in for a leisurely meal, our comfortable space ensures a relaxing dining experience for individuals, families, and groups alike.
Address & Hours

Glenview, IL 60016

yaba's Middle Eastern Grill is a family-owned and operated Middle Eastern restaurant located in Logan Square. We offer Delicious Middle Eastern and Mediterranean food serving up shawarma, gyros, pies, hummus, and a lot more options on our menu. everything we serve is hand-made, our Falafels, Lentil Soup, and veggie plates are a go-to for a lot of people. Our falafels and Lentil soup have been named to be the best in Chicago. We guarantee a casual dining experience with authentic Middle Eastern and Mediterranean dishes, Our customers praise us for our friendly service, great food, and huge portions. Yaba's Middle Eastern Grill is open 7 days a week and is ready to make your lunch and dinner experience better.

Sunday Specials
See All Specials
Chicago Specials
Lombard Specials
Suckling Pig Fournou
Tender and juicy baby pig, oven roasted to perfection served with potatoes.
Bar-B-Q Lamb
This traditional Colorodo lamb favorite is flavored with rosemary, garlic, extra virgin olive oil lemon with a splash of white wine.
Lamb Yiouvesti
Chunks of Colorodo lamb, in a tomato sauce, served with orzo and sprinkled with cheese.
Dessert Special: Bougatsa
Flaky triangle filo dough, stuffed with baked custard sprinkled with cinnamon and powdered  sugar
Suckling Pig
Tender and juicy baby pig - oven roasted with choice of rice and potato or mixed vegetables
Lavraki
Whole mediterranean bass (lavraki) with choice of rice and potato or mixed vegetables.
Mediterranean Salmon
Fresh Atlantic salmon cooked in an oven bag with fresh julienne vegetables, extra virgin olive oil, herbs and spices served with rice.
Seabass from Greece
Fresh whole mediterranean seabass with choice of rice and potato or mixed vegetables
See All Specials
Authentic Ingredients
Greek Islands is proud to import its own extra virgin olive oil, wine, cheeses, seafood, olives, herbs and spices directly from Greece. We only use healthy, natural and fresh ingredients in our cooking.
Discover the Greek Islands
Welcome Home
A group of friends realized the American dream that many immigrants had — they opened their own business after many years of hard work. From humble beginnings they grew their business into the most popular Greek restaurant in the United States.
Our goal remains to make it feel like home when you walk through our doors. We look forward to treating you like family!

City Winery Chicago | Restaurant & Winery
We thoughtfully pair our world-class wines with delectable, Mediterranean-inspired dishes.
choose your experience
Winery Tour & Tastings
Lock in your visit to tour our urban Winery and participate in our world-class famous Wine Tastings!
Happy Hour
Indoors or outside on our patio - Enjoy our famous wines on tap, our fabulous flatbreads, as well as our variety of dips served with pita all for half price! Every Monday through Friday 4-7pm.
Winery Experiences
Try one of our offered winery experiences and explore the craft up close
Private Dining
Inquire about our versatile, urban private rooms, perfect for corporate luncheons, romantic date night dinners and more. Enjoy exclusive use of our Private Dining Room for you and your closest friends.

enjoy the flavors & traditions of the region
mediterranean comfort food
fresh & healthy ingredients go into every plate
Mediterranean dishes are some of the most flavorful, fresh and varied cuisines in the culinary canon and one of the most healthy styles of eating in existence. Our hearty pasta dishes, sauces and dips are all homemade and change with the seasons. We cook locally and seasonally and we source our produce locally when available.

YAY! organic options
and pita bread that's a must!!
"At last...good food with organic options! We stumbled across this gem of a place when we were in this cute neighborhood. We ordered the two crab cakes appetizer, the organic chicken (with potatoes and spinach), and a couscous dish. Everything was great! It was the best chicken I've ever had in any restaurant, anywhere. "

Welcome to Caffè Oliva at
Ohio Street Beach
Looking for the best beach dining in Chicago? Welcome to Caffè Oliva at Ohio Street Beach, an oasis with stunning lakefront views, refreshing cocktails, and a laid-back, island-inspired atmosphere. Whether you're soaking up the sun, enjoying a romantic dinner by the water, or grabbing drinks with friends, Caffè Oliva at Ohio Street Beach is the perfect place to unwind in the summertime.
Explore Menu
Cabanas
Food, Drinks & Chicago's Favorite Beach Experience.
At Caffè Oliva, summer vibes meet breathtaking lakefront views at Ohio Street Beach. Whether you're cooling off with a crisp cocktail, sharing a seaside meal with friends, or soaking up the sun just steps from the water, every moment here feels like an escape. With fresh, flavorful bites, refreshing drinks, and a laid-back beachside atmosphere, Caffè Oliva at Ohio Street Beach is your go-to spot for unwinding by the lake. Feel the breeze, sip, savor, and stay a while—because nothing beats a beach day in Chicago.
Hours
Open May-October
MONDAY-THURSDAY
11:00 A.M. –9:00 P.M.
FRIDAY-SUNDAY
10:00 A.M. – 10:00 P.M.
The
Experience
Food
Fresh flavors, beachside bites. Savor fresh seafood, crisp salads, and handheld favorites—all perfectly paired with the sun, sand, and a refreshing drink in hand.
Drinks
From handcrafted cocktails to ice-cold beers and crisp summer wines, our drink menu is designed for perfect beach days. Whether you're craving a tropical drink or a refreshing spritz, every sip comes with a side of lakefront bliss.
Beach Vibes
Good vibes, great music, and the best seat on the beach. Whether you're enjoying live music by the lake or unwinding in a private cabana, every moment at Caffè Oliva is designed for relaxation and fun.
Menus
Please note, we do not accept reservations for regular dining service.
View Menus
Cabanas
Looking for a place to relax, eat and drink on the beach? Book one of our cabanas that seat up to 25 guests.
Book Now
Visit Us
Come experience Caffè Oliva at Ohio Street Beach!
Directions
Private Events
Think family reunions, corporate off-sites, athletic trips, bachelor and bachelorette celebrations, birthdays – whatever brings your favorite people together, we’d love to have you here!
Learn More
Wellbeing Surcharge
A 3% charge is added to all checks to help fund programs such as health insurance, 401(k) and other fringe benefits provided to our employees. This charge is not mandatory and can be removed upon your request. We thank you for supporting a healthier & happier restaurant staff.
Learn More

Heads up, we are no longer accepting applications for 2025 J1 students. Our hiring team is in the process of reviewing all existing applications.​We appreciate your understanding!

Caffè Oliva offers discounted parking at the 500 N Lake Shore Drive Building. The garage entrance is located at 509 N Peshtigo between East Grand Ave and East Illinois St. Bring your ticket to the bar and one of the bartenders will be happy to validate your ticket.  A purchase is required for validation.
Please note the parking availability is subject to capacity and may not be available if garage is full.

Greek Prime
Authentic Flavors | Fresh Ingredients
Welcome
Neighborhood Eatery with Authentic Greek Flavors
GREEK PRIME Kitchen & Bar brings the authentic flavors of Greece to the Chicagoland area. From traditional specialties to one-of-a-kind twists on Greek street food, we offer something delicious for every foodie.
Our Menu
Quality Ingredients, Delicious Meals
The recipes for our traditional Greek specialties have been passed down through generations of family cooking and use only the finest and freshest ingredients available. In addition to traditional flavors, our menu also offers an array of modern/fusion takes on Greek street food, unique to Greek Prime. Rounding out our menu are your American bar-food favorites, and house-made desserts that are hand-made every single day.

hello, chicago.
we’re ready to treat you to real food & serious flavor.
Location & Hours
Download Menu
Group Dining
Catering Menu
Seasonal Menu
At True Food Kitchen, our menu is carefully crafted so that every bite and every refreshing sip serve up big flavor, an abundance of fresh ingredients and a taste of the unexpected. Our artisan chefs create crave-worthy classics alongside a steady rotation of seasonal offerings that take advantage of naturally ripe fruits and vegetables so their flavor is full and their nutrients, rich. Creative, hand-crafted beverages built around seasonality, quality ingredients and simple preparations complement every occasion from brunch, lunch, dinner and, of course, dessert. Always room for dessert.
Important Information About Our Menu
Menu pricing varies by location – to view location-specific menus, visit our
locations
page.
*These items may be served raw or undercooked. Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions.
Please be aware that our restaurants use gluten and ingredients that contain all the major FDA allergens (peanuts, tree nuts, eggs, fish, shellfish, milk, sesame, soy and wheat).
Our restaurants have shared cooking and preparation areas and the possibility exists for food items to come into contact with other food products. Due to these circumstances, we are unable to guarantee that any menu item can be completely free of allergens. In addition, while effort is made to keep our product information current and as complete as possible, it is possible that ingredient changes and substitutions may occur due to differences in regional suppliers, recipe revisions, preparation techniques, and/or the season of the year.
Before placing your order, please inform your server if someone in your party has a food allergy or a special dietary need and we will do our best to make accommodations.
View our nutritional guide
here
.

GRATUITY
We add a 20% gratuity for parties larger than 5 to ensure that all team members are earning an equitable wage in addition to the benefits that we offer, such as paid sick leave, health insurance, and matching retirement plan.
MODIFICATIONS
Menu modifications during peak hours may add significant cook time to your order, thank you for understanding.

1023 W Wilson Avenue |773.654.3175 |
SET MENU $33.99/person
Reservations Are
Appetizer
1. Lentil Sambusa (2)
A Lentil Sambusa is a crispy, golden-fried pastry filled with a flavorful mixture of lentils, onions, garlic, and
Ethiopian spices
Main
2. Veggie Combo
(served for 1 with injera and portion of each of six dishes)
A combination platter of traditional Ethiopian vegetarian dishes, including Yemisir Wat (spicy red lentil
stew), Kik Alicha (mild yellow split pea stew), cabbage (slow-cooked with carrots and turmeric), brown
lentils (seasoned and simmered), Gomen (collard greens sautéed with garlic and spices), and beetroot
(earthy and slightly sweet, often served warm or chilled). Served with injera, a spongy Ethiopian
flatbread, for scooping up the flavorful dishes.
Drink
3. Ethiopian Coffee or Tea
Enjoy a cup of authentic Ethiopian coffee, known for its rich, bold flavor and smooth finish, often
served in a traditional coffee ceremony. Alternatively, savor Ethiopian spiced tea, a fragrant and
soothing beverage infused with cinnamon, cloves, and other warming spices.

menu
MOST POPULAR
INGREDIENTS
FROZEN SUPERFOOD BARS
Our most popular product line.  Think nostalgic "ice cream" like superfood and adaptogenic packed bar.  Store frozen, enjoy frozen!  We have created thousands of flavors over the years add new flavors to our menu daily, however popular flavors we often have include:
Slutty Brownie Bar | Grandma's Crumb Cake Bar | PB Cup Sundae Bar | Gooey Caramel Cookie Dough Bar
BUTTER CUPS
Think "Reese's" butter cup experience, but magnified.  House-ground nut butters (or cookie doughs) covered in our own dark chocolate exterior.  We add new flavors regularly, however popular flavors we often have include:
Peanut Butter Cup | Cookie Dough Cup | Caramel Cashew Cup | White Chocolate Caramel Walnut Cup
BALLS
Think like a protein-ball, or at times cake-ball like experience.  The textures vary across flavors but these super snackable on the go items are great to share.  We add new flavors regularly, however popular flavors we often have include:
Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookie | Cookies N Cream | Twix x Snickerz
BAKED GOODS
Truly, we pride ourselves on our incredible chocolate chip cookies but we have usually have a small assortment of baked goods for the day, often including but not limited to:
Chocolate Chip Cookies | Iced Rainbow Sprinkle Cookies | "Moosetrack" Cookies | The Ultimate Cake | Cookie Butter x Cookie Dough Cake | Peanut Butter Cup Cookie Dough Cake
Click here to view a list of ingredients in our items
100% of the items from our shop are Vegan and free of Gluten, Refined Sugar, Refined Oil & Soy.  We are "allergen friendly", EXCEPT when it comes to peanuts and tree nuts.  All items contain some type of nut, and if there is an allergy please know cross contamination across nuts can occur.  If you would like to know the ingredients of any particular item and are having trouble finding the ingredients, please text our business line 312-248-2862 and we will reply.

D I N N E R
W I N E  ‎ L I S T
Our seasonal menus are rooted in tradition; melding rustic sensibility with contemporary flair.
We highlight the best of the season, favoring local artisan growers using sustainable practices. We take the same care with our wine and cocktail lists as we do with our dining menus, emphasizing interesting, artisanal winemakers and showcasing housemade cocktails.
We proudly encourage craftsmanship and the revival of traditional practices.

GRATUITY
We add a 20% gratuity for parties larger than 5 to ensure that all team members are earning an equitable wage in addition to the benefits that we offer, such as paid sick leave, health insurance, and matching retirement plan.
MODIFICATIONS
Menu modifications during peak hours may add significant cook time to your order, thank you for understanding.
GLUTEN FRIENDLY & ALLERGENS
Highly sensitive guests, please note— a Gluten-Friendly Menu
is available for your convenience from the navigation above.
*On the Gluten-Friendly Menu,
items with asterisks are created using shared equipment, utensils, and fryer oil. Despite precautions, total allergen isolation cannot be guaranteed.

JOIN US
JOIN US
​
The Bronzeville Winery Wine Collective is a space
for
the diverse world of wine enthusiasts of all types (beginners & snobs welcome) to use wine as a vehicle to connect, grow, imagine and inspire. Bronzeville Winery has worked with a team of Master Sommeliers, Chefs, Artists and Musicians to create a collection of curated experiences that can be enjoyed both from the comfort of one's home paired with a record or inside the walls of the Bronzeville Winery paired with beautiful new friends, live music and memories that will last a life time. Taking notes from our sister concept, The Silver Room, community, art & expression is and will always be at our core. And now, we are ready to take it a step further.

Careers
about
Oriole
is a contemporary-American restaurant located in Chicago’s West Loop neighborhood featuring
Executive Chef and Owner Noah Sandoval’s
award winning tasting menu. Since Oriole’s opening in 2016, it has repeatedly earned two Michelin stars and received the Jean Banchet Award for Restaurant of the Year in 2022.
Chef Sandoval
named Best Chef (Great Lakes) by the James Beard Foundation in 2025, and was named one of Food & Wine’s Best New Chefs in 2017.
Our chefs offer an extended tasting. menu that is constantly evolving. We are excited to share it with you!

Virgin Hotels
Chicago
Eat & Drink
Miss Ricky's
Have Seconds In The Second City
When it comes to the Chicago food scene, Miss Ricky’s is one restaurant you don’t want to miss. Walk past the wall of cut-off ties and miniskirts (you’ll have to ask Sir Richard Branson for the story behind that one), take a seat and get comfortable – you’re going to want to stay a while.
Whether it’s breakfast, brunch, lunch, dinner or somewhere in between, you can expect made-from-scratch Italian dishes that would make Nonna proud.
Looking to turn a casual dinner into an elegant soirée? Why not book The Casting Room – a lush space with curtain-covered walls, velvet lounges and vintage gold stage lights. Mamma mia!
Opening Times
Brunch:
Monday - Friday: 7am - 2pm
Saturday -Sunday: 8am - 2pm
Dinner:
Daily 4-10pm
